ProgramName: Master of Accountancy (MAcc)
EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the language of instruction must have a TOEFL score of at least 550 (PBT), 213 (CBT), or 79 (IBT) or an IELTS score of 6.0.
Requirements:
To be admitted with Regular Admission Status to the MAcc Program, applicants must meet the following requirements:

1. An undergraduate degree from a regionally accredited college or university.
2. An undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
3. An upper-division (junior and senior level courses) GPA in accounting of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
4. GMAT score of 500 or better. The GMAT is an essential component of the application and students must take the GMAT before being considered for admission to the MAcc program. However, students who meet one or more of the following criteria may waive the GMAT requirement:
   * An undergraduate overall GPA of 3.25 or higher from an AACSB accredited business school.
   * Passed all four parts of the CPA exam.
   * Hold a graduate degree from an accredited U.S. university.
   * Have five or more years of professional work experience in accounting.
   * Belong to Beta Alpha Psi (BAP) with a GPA of 3.25 or higher.
5. Completed the following prerequisite courses with a grade of C or better:
   * Financial Accounting (ACCT 200)
   * Managerial Accounting (ACCT 210)
   * Intermediate Accounting I & II (ACCT 300 & 301)
   * Cost Accounting (ACCT 310)
   * Accounting Information Systems (ACCT 320)
   * Income Tax I (ACCT 403)
   * Auditing (ACCT 410)
   * Principles of Management (MGMT 330)
   * Principles of Marketing (MRKT 340)
   * Corporation Finance (FINA 362)
   * Legal Environment of Business (BLAW 200)
   * Business Statistics (SCMS 255)
   * Micro Economics (ECON 201)
   * Macro Economics (ECON 202)
Department: College of Business
Description: The Master of Accountancy (MAcc) Program at Minnesota State University, Mankato is designed to meet the needs of both career-changers and those already in the accounting profession seeking to fulfill the 150-credit hour requirement to be licensed as a CPA in Minnesota and other states. The MAcc program has a strong reputation for providing a high-quality, affordable, and convenient way for you to achieve your professional and academic goals. Courses in the MAcc program are offered on-campus, online, and in a hybrid format. All required courses for the program are offered online. Students may complete the MAcc degree fully online, on campus, or in a combination that best meets their needs.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International, which represents the highest standard of achievement for business schools worldwide. Less than 5% of the world's 13,000 business programs have earned AACSB Accreditation. AACSB-accredited schools produce graduates that are highly skilled and more desirable to employers than other non-accredited schools. The Department of Accounting has also been granted separate AACSB Accreditation, a distinction that only 186 universities worldwide have achieved.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Art and Design
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met with: a minimum score of 79 on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT) with a minimum score of 17 on the speaking and writing sections; a minimum score of 6.5 on the IELTS; a minimum score of 110 on the Duolingo English Test; a minimum score of 53 on the PTE Academic; or successful completion of Level 112 in an ELS Language Center.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Master of Arts in Art and Design program, an applicant must have completed an undergraduate major in art or design, a related discipline, or have completed at least 30 semester credits of undergraduate studio art and art history. All applicants must meet the general requirements for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research. Admission to the Department of Art & Design will be based on the following:
1. Statement of Purpose: A letter stating the applicant’s intent in undertaking graduate study in art and design. This letter should describe the applicant’s specific area(s) of interest within the discipline as well as any relevant academic, professional, and personal experience.
2. Portfolio of Original Work: A portfolio of 15–20 examples of the applicant’s best and most recent work submitted as a single PDF. The portfolio should include a title page, a complete image list, and a table of contents.
3. Letters of Recommendation: Three current letters of recommendation from former teachers or others who have a direct knowledge of the applicant’s academic and/or artistic ability.
4. Official Transcripts: All post-secondary transcripts must be sent to the College of Graduate Studies.
5. Graduate Record Exam (GRE): Not required for this program.
6. Writing Sample: An academic writing sample may be requested by the graduate coordinator after a review of other required materials.
Department: College of Humanities and Social Sciences
Concentration: Ceramics, Drawing, Fibers, Graphic Design, Painting, Printmaking, Sculpture
Description: The Master of Arts in Art and Design degree is for students who want to continue their studies in art and design in a scholarly direction. It is a one-year program that prepares students for further graduate study in art history or for a variety of professional opportunities in museums and galleries. The program does not require a studio emphasis, as the MFA degree does. It is designed to further develop a student's critical, analytical, and writing skills as well as to increase their knowledge and understanding of historical and contemporary art. It is the appropriate degree for graduates who do not intend to teach at the university level.
Accredidation: Minnesota State University, Mankato is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Communication and Media
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English must provide evidence of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT (79), TOEFL PBT (550), IELTS (6.5), PTE Academic (53), Duolingo English Test (110), or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Completed application for admission to graduate study. Application fee (non-refundable). Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. A statement of purpose (no more than 500 words). Two letters of recommendation. International students are required to meet English Language Proficiency requirements.
Department: College of Humanities and Social Sciences
Description: The Master of Arts in Communication and Media provides students with a program of study focused on human and technologically-mediated communication. This program is for students interested in advanced study and professional growth in communication and media. Our MA students engage with the complex and evolving media and communication environment of the 21st century through innovative instruction, creative activity, and original research. The program emphasizes critical thinking, communication and media theory, diverse research methods, and media production. Our graduates have pursued further graduate education at the Ph.D. level or entered careers in strategic communication, public relations, integrated marketing, media industries, higher education, non-profit, consulting, and management.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in English
DeadlineDate: Fall Semester: July 1 (final), Spring Semester: October 15
EnglishScore: Evidence of English language proficiency is required of all applicants whose native language is not English, regardless of U.S. citizenship status.
Requirements:
Students must meet the admission requirements of the College of Graduate Studies and Research (mnsu.edu/grad).

Students seeking admission to the MA program in English must submit the following materials to the College of Graduate Studies and Research:

A writing sample that demonstrates the applicant's ability to succeed in the program's graduate coursework. The writing sample should consist of 8-15 pages of polished, academic writing that makes an argument about a literary or cultural text. The writing sample may be a single paper or two shorter papers.
A 1-2 page statement of purpose that explains the applicant's preparation for graduate study in English and his or her goals for the program.
Three letters of recommendation from individuals who are familiar with the applicant's academic work. At least two of the letters should be from former professors.
A curriculum vitae (CV) or résumé.
Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
Department: College of Humanities and Social Sciences
Concentration: ['Literature and Critical Theory', 'Teaching Writing and Literature', 'Creative Writing']
Description: The Master of Arts in English is designed for students who want to deepen their skills of literary and cultural interpretation, written and oral communication, critical thinking, and advanced research. The MA in English is an excellent credential for teaching at the community-college level, for applying to PhD programs, and for a wide range of other professions requiring advanced skills in reading, writing, and research, such as publishing, technical writing, professional writing, and public relations.
ScholarshipAmount: a stipend of $12,000 for the nine-month academic year

ProgramName: Master of Arts in English Education
EnglishScore: All applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT 79, IELTS 6.5, Duolingo English Test (DET) 110, Pearson Test of English (PTE) 53, or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements:
In addition to the admission requirements of the College of Graduate Studies and Research, applicants must have:

1. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
2. A bachelor's degree in English or English education. Students without an English or English Education background will be required to take up to twelve (12) undergraduate credits in English in order to satisfy deficiencies.
3. A statement of purpose explaining the applicant's reasons for wanting to do graduate work in English and what he/she hopes to do with the degree.
4. A critical writing sample of 5-10 pages.
5. Two (2) letters of recommendation from former professors or other professionals who can comment on the applicant’s academic potential.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Master of Arts in English Education provides students the opportunity for advanced study in the fields of language, literature, writing, and pedagogy, enabling them to expand and deepen their expertise as teachers and scholars. Students work with committed and nationally recognized faculty to further develop their expertise in the field of English education. Many of our students are practicing teachers in K-12 and post-secondary settings, while others are recent graduates seeking more experience and knowledge before entering the teaching profession. The program offers face-to-face, hybrid, and online options that meet the needs of a variety of student schedules. All students will work on an individual basis with a graduate advisor to develop a course of study best suited to their individual goals and interests.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Gender and Women's Studies
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency by meeting one of the following requirements: TOEFL iBT score of 79 or higher (with minimum subscores of 17); IELTS score of 6.5 or higher (with minimum subscores of 6.0); PTE score of 53 or higher (with minimum subscores of 47); Duolingo English Test score of 110 or higher (with minimum subscores of 90); or completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements: To apply to the Gender & Women's Studies Master's Program, please submit the following through the College of Graduate Studies and Research application portal: Completed Graduate Application for Admission. Application fee. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions. Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to the applicant's academic potential. A statement of purpose, approximately 500-1000 words, that addresses the following: The applicant’s experience in Gender & Women’s Studies or a related field; The applicant’s academic and career goals and how a M.A. in GWS will help meet those goals; Specific areas of interest in Gender & Women’s Studies; Why the applicant wants to pursue graduate study at Minnesota State University, Mankato. A writing sample of approximately 10-15 pages that demonstrates strong writing and analytical skills. The sample should be a formal academic paper, preferably written for an upper-division course. International students must also submit official TOEFL or IELTS scores that meet the minimum requirements of the College of Graduate Studies and Research.
Department: College of Social & Behavioral Sciences
Description: The Master of Arts in Gender & Women's Studies is an interdisciplinary program designed to provide students with a comprehensive and in-depth understanding of the complex intersections of gender, sexuality, race, class, and other social categories. The program offers a rigorous academic curriculum that combines theoretical foundations with practical applications, preparing graduates for a wide range of careers in academia, advocacy, non-profit organizations, and public service. Students will explore a diverse range of topics, including feminist theory, queer theory, transnational feminism, gender and globalization, and social justice. The program is committed to fostering a supportive and inclusive learning environment where students can engage in critical dialogue, research, and community activism. Students can choose between a Thesis or an Alternate Plan Paper (APP) to complete their degree.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Industrial-Organizational Psychology
EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required for graduate study. This requirement can be satisfied with one of the following: TOEFL score of 79 iBT (with a minimum of 17 on speaking and writing sections) or 550 PBT; IELTS score of 6.5; PTE Academic score of 53; Duolingo English Test score of 110; ELS Language Center's Level 112.
Requirements: A complete graduate application consists of the following materials: Completed graduate application form and fee; Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended, sent directly to the Graduate College; Personal Statement (limit 1,000 words): Discuss a.) your interests and career goals, b.) why you have chosen the I/O Psychology M.A. program at Minnesota State, Mankato, and c.) a significant accomplishment and a significant mistake.; Resume/CV; Three letters of recommendation; GRE is optional; Official TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo scores (for international applicants); Application deadline: January 15
Department: College of Science, Engineering & Technology
Description: The Industrial-Organizational (I-O) Psychology graduate program is a rigorous Master of Arts degree designed to prepare students for careers in I-O related fields in a variety of organizations or to enter a doctoral program. Our program follows the scientist-practitioner model of I-O psychology, which emphasizes the connection between scientific principles and professional practice. Our students receive strong foundational coursework in I-O psychology, research methods and statistics, with an emphasis in the application of this knowledge to real-world problems. The program typically requires two years of full-time study and students complete an applied research-based thesis as the capstone requirement. The program does not offer distance education options.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Literature and English Studies
EnglishScore: International students whose native language is not English must provide evidence of English proficiency. Minnesota State University, Mankato accepts the following exams and minimum scores: TOEFL iBT: a total score of 79 with a minimum writing score of 20 and a minimum reading score of 19, IELTS: a total score of 6.5 with no band below 6.0, PTE Academic: a total score of 53 with no band below 49, Duolingo: a total score of 110, ELS: graduation from Level 112 of the English Language Services (ELS) intensive program.
Requirements:
Admission to the M.A. in Literature and English Studies program requires the following:
- A baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution.
- An undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
- A grade of B or better in at least 18 credits of upper-division (300-400 level) undergraduate English courses. Applicants with fewer than 18 credits may be admitted provisionally.

In addition to the online application and application fee, applicants must submit the following materials:
- Transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
- Two letters of recommendation from former professors that speak to your potential for success in a graduate program.
- A personal statement (statement of purpose) of approximately 500-750 words.
- A critical writing sample of approximately 10-15 pages.
- A résumé
Department: College of Humanities and Social Sciences
Description: The Master of Arts in Literature and English Studies is an innovative, flexible graduate program that emphasizes multiculturalism and interdisciplinary studies. Students choose from a range of courses in literary and cultural studies, creative writing, linguistics, literature, rhetoric, and writing studies to suit their scholarly, professional, and personal goals. The program has particular strengths in American multicultural literatures, children's and young adult literature, creative writing, cultural studies, contemporary literary theory, linguistics, and rhetoric and composition. The program offers a thesis and an alternate plan paper option. Recent graduates have pursued PhDs and MFAs at programs across the country; have taught at the secondary and postsecondary levels; have become professional writers, editors, and librarians; and have assumed positions in a range of public and private sector jobs.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages
EnglishScore: International applicants must provide evidence of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores for full admission are: TOEFL iBT score of 79 (with a minimum of 17 on each section), IELTS overall score of 6.5 (with a minimum of 6.0 on each band), Duolingo English Test (DET) score of 110, Pearson Test of English (PTE) overall score of 53 (with a minimum of 47 on each band), or successful completion of Level 112 in the ELS Language Centers Academic English Program.
Requirements:
Baccalaureate degree from an accredited university.
A grade point average of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
Letter of intent which explains in 500 words or less why the student wishes to pursue this degree.
A résumé listing relevant work and/or volunteer experience.
Two letters of reference.
An academic writing sample (e.g. a paper written for an undergraduate course).
Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required.
TOEFL iBT of 79, IELTS of 6.0, Duolingo of 100, or PTE of 53 (if the undergraduate degree was not from an English medium university).
A personal interview may be required.
Department: College of Humanities and Social Sciences
Description: The Master of Arts in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (MA in TESOL) is a professional degree designed for those who wish to teach English to speakers of other languages in a variety of settings in the United States or abroad. The program provides a strong foundation in the theoretical and pedagogical aspects of second language acquisition, linguistics, cross-cultural communication, and language teaching methodology. Graduates are prepared for careers as ESL/EFL teachers, curriculum developers, program administrators, and teacher trainers in K-12 public and private schools, community colleges, universities, and private language institutes.
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $1,500 for departmental scholarships; Graduate Assistantships include a $10,000 stipend and tuition waiver.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Teaching: K-12 and Secondary Programs (MAT)
EnglishScore: All applicants for graduate study, regardless of citizenship, must demonstrate proficiency in English. This can be met by providing an official score report from one of the following: TOEFL iBT: 79 (with minimum subscores of 17), TOEFL pBT: 550 (with minimum subscores of 53), IELTS: 6.5 (with minimum subscores of 6.0), Duolingo: 110, PTE Academic: 53, or ELS: 112.
Requirements: Completed application to the College of Graduate Studies and Research. A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited university. An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. (Applicants with an undergraduate GPA between 2.75 and 2.99 can be considered for provisional admission. Students admitted provisionally must earn a 3.0 GPA in the first nine (9) credits of graduate coursework to be moved to full admission status.) Official transcript from the institution where you earned your bachelor’s degree. Statement of purpose. (In two pages, double spaced, describe a) your reason for pursuing a Master of Arts in Teaching, b) your personal qualities and experiences that will make you a successful classroom teacher, and c) your commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion in education.) A professional resume. Names and contact information for two professional references. (A link will be sent to your recommenders to complete a recommendation form. At least one reference must be from a faculty member who can attest to your academic performance if you have graduated within the past 5 years. For applicants who have graduated more than five years ago, two professional letters of recommendation are acceptable.) For non-native English speakers, an English language proficiency test is required. A content review form verifying a major or a course equivalency in your intended licensure area. (This will be available within the online application.)
Department: College of Education
Concentration: ['Academic and Behavioral Strategist', 'Agriculture', 'Art', 'Business', 'Chemistry', 'Communication Arts & Literature', 'Developmental Disabilities', 'Early Childhood', 'Earth & Space Science', 'Emotional Behavioral Disorders', 'Family and Consumer Science', 'Health', 'Learning Disabilities', 'Life Science', 'Mathematics', 'Music', 'Physical Education', 'Physics', 'Social Studies', 'Spanish', 'TESL', 'Technology Education', 'Theatre Arts']
Description: The Master of Arts in Teaching (MAT) is an initial teacher licensure program for individuals with a bachelor's degree who want to become a K-12 or secondary teacher. Students can choose from a number of different licensure areas. The coursework is delivered in a blended format - a mix of online and face-to-face instruction - and field experiences take place in K-12 schools. Once accepted into the MAT program, faculty will review your transcripts to develop a course of study for you to meet the Minnesota licensure requirements and complete the MAT degree. Our MAT students have a broad range of life experiences and education that lead them to become teachers. The MAT program values these different experiences and the variety of perspectives students bring to the program and to the classroom.
Accredidation: The College of Education at Minnesota State University, Mankato is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

ProgramName: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
EnglishScore: International applicants must meet English proficiency requirements. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT 79 (with minimum writing score of 20 and speaking score of 20), IELTS 6.5 overall band score, Duolingo English Test 110, Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic 58, or completion of Level 112 from an ELS Language Center.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, applicants must submit the following: Application to the College of Graduate Studies and Research; Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended (applicants must have an undergraduate degree from a regionally-accredited U.S. institution or a bachelor's-level equivalent from a foreign institution); GMAT or GRE test scores (a minimum GMAT score of 500 or an equivalent GRE score is expected for unconditional admission); A current resume; A 1-2 page statement of purpose (essay) that describes your reasons for pursuing the MBA degree, your short-term and long-term goals, and what you will bring to the MBA program at Minnesota State Mankato. The GMAT/GRE requirement is waived for applicants with one of the following: a cumulative undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher from a U.S. institution; an earned graduate degree (master's, doctorate, or professional degree) from an accredited U.S. institution with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher; five or more years of progressive professional work experience; active professional certification (CPA, CFA, CMA, or CSCP). Two letters of recommendation are optional for all MBA applicants.
Department: College of Business
Description: The Minnesota State Mankato MBA is a 30-credit graduate program that offers an innovative approach to business education within a flexible format that allows students to enroll part-time or full-time. Classes are a mixture of online and synchronous remote, which provides flexibility along with interaction and networking with faculty and classmates. The curriculum is designed to provide a broad-based, cross-functional understanding of business principles and their application in a global context.
Accredidation: AACSB-International

ProgramName: Master of Fine Arts in Creative Writing
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency through one of several options, including minimum scores on the TOEFL, IELTS, PTE Academic, or Duolingo English Test, completion of ELS Level 112, or graduation from specific institutions where English is the language of instruction.
Requirements:
In addition to the College of Graduate Studies and Research application requirements, the Creative Writing program requires the following:

A 10-25 page manuscript (double spaced, Times New Roman 12 pt font) of your best creative work in the genre in which you plan to study (poetry, fiction, or creative nonfiction). The manuscript may consist of several pieces or a single piece.
A one-to-two page statement of purpose, written in Times New Roman 12 pt font, explaining your reasons for pursuing an MFA degree in Creative Writing, your background in the field, your specific interests within your genre, and your goals for your time at Minnesota State University, Mankato. The statement of purpose is a professional document that should be well-written, carefully edited, and specifically tailored to our program.
Two letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to your academic and creative abilities.
The undergraduate transcript.
The GRE is NOT required for admission to the Creative Writing Program.
Department: College of Humanities and Social Sciences
Concentration: fiction, creative nonfiction, and poetry
Description: The Master of Fine Arts in Creative Writing at Minnesota State University, Mankato, is a three-year, 48-credit-hour program offering concentrations in fiction, creative nonfiction, and poetry. MFA candidates take a variety of specialized workshops and literature courses and typically complete a creative thesis of high literary merit. The MFA program is home to the Blue Earth Review, a national literary journal; the Good Thunder Reading Series, which brings a diverse roster of professional writers to campus each year; and it is an AWP-certified program. Students receive full financial support in the form of teaching assistantships, which include a full tuition waiver and a competitive stipend. Our program prides itself on giving students substantial pedagogical training and diverse teaching experiences. All of our graduate assistants have the opportunity to teach first-year composition and creative writing.
Accredidation: AWP-certified program

ProgramName: Master of Fine Arts in Theatre Arts
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English must submit evidence of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT 61, IELTS 5.5, Duolingo 95, PTE Academic 47, or completion of ELS Language Center Level 112.
Requirements: In addition to the online application and application fee required by the College of Graduate Studies and Research, you must also submit the following directly to the Department of Theatre & Dance: A current resume. A 500-word statement of purpose which discusses your goals and objectives in seeking an MFA degree in Theatre Arts from Minnesota State University, Mankato. Three current letters of recommendation. A campus visit, which will include an interview and an audition or portfolio review. An audition is required for applicants in acting and musical theatre. A portfolio review is required for applicants in design/technology, directing, and dance. Applicants are considered for admission only after all application materials have been received.
Department: College of Arts and Humanities
Concentration: acting, directing, costume design, scenic design, lighting design, and sound design
Description: The Master of Fine Arts (MFA) in Theatre Arts is a terminal degree program, providing students with pre-professional training in one of six areas of emphasis: acting, directing, costume design, scenic design, lighting design, and sound design. The MFA degree is designed to provide students with the highest level of training possible in a particular area of theatre, while also providing a well-rounded education in the art of theatre. Graduate students work with faculty on a one-to-one basis and have the opportunity to showcase their work through a variety of production opportunities both on and off campus.
Accredidation: The Department of Theatre and Dance is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Theatre (NAST).
ScholarshipAmount: Stipend of $5,000 to $10,000 for the academic year and a tuition waiver for 6-9 credits per semester.

ProgramName: Master of Public Health (MPH)
EnglishScore: For international applicants, proof of English proficiency is required. This can be met with a minimum TOEFL iBT of 79, IELTS of 6.5, Duolingo of 110, PTE Academic of 53, or completion of ELS Level 112, among other qualifications.
Requirements: Admission to the MPH program is based on a holistic review of each student's application. Applicants must meet the admission requirements of the College of Graduate Studies and Research. In addition, the following are required for full admission to the MPH program: A baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited college or university. An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. A completed application submitted to the College of Graduate Studies and Research. Three (3) letters of recommendation. At least one recommendation must be from a former professor/instructor who can attest to the student's academic abilities. Recommendations from employers are also acceptable. A 1–2-page statement of purpose that includes: Reasons for interest in public health and the MPH degree at Minnesota State University, Mankato. Professional goals and aspirations. Strengths that will help you succeed in graduate school. Current resume or curriculum vitae. TOEFL scores (for international students only).
Department: College of Allied Health and Nursing
Concentration: Community Health Education, Public Health Practice
Description: The Master of Public Health (MPH) degree at Minnesota State University, Mankato is designed for students from a variety of undergraduate disciplines who are looking for a career in public health. The program provides the foundational knowledge, skills, and abilities to be a successful public health professional. The MPH program has two concentrations, Community Health Education and Public Health Practice. The program is offered online in an asynchronous format and can be completed in as few as 1.5 years of full-time study. Students in the program must complete 42 credits including 24 core credits, 12 concentration credits, and 6 culminating credits. The Community Health Education concentration has a curriculum designed to provide graduates with the skills to sit for the Certified Health Education Specialist (CHES) exam. The Public Health Practice concentration allows students to select 12 credits of graduate elective courses based on professional interests.
Accredidation: The Master of Public Health program at Minnesota State University, Mankato is an applicant for accreditation by the Council on Education for Public Health (CEPH). The accreditation review will address the Master of Public Health program. Other degrees and areas of study offered by this institution are not included in the unit of accreditation review.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Advanced Dental Therapy
EnglishScore: You must submit proof of English proficiency by providing one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT score of 79 (with a minimum writing score of 20 and a minimum speaking score of 20), International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score of 6.5 (with no subscore below 6.0), Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic score of 53, Duolingo English Test score of 110, or ELS Language Center Level 112. Other forms of proof may also be accepted, such as completion of credits at a U.S. institution or a diploma from an institution where English is the language of instruction.
Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research, applicants for admission to the Master of Science in Advanced Dental Therapy program must have the following:

- Application for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research
- Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
- Bachelor’s degree in dental hygiene from a CODA-accredited dental hygiene program OR Completion of a dental hygiene program and a bachelor’s degree in a related field from a regionally-accredited institution.
- Minimum 3.0 undergraduate GPA (on a 4.0 scale).
- Personal Statement/Essay addressing: Why you are choosing to further your education at Minnesota State University, Mankato. What are your future career goals? How will this degree help you achieve these goals? What is your philosophy of dental hygiene/dental therapy? Please include any experiences that have shaped this philosophy. Essay should be a maximum of 500 words.
- Current Resume/CV.
- Copy of current dental hygiene license.
- Copy of current CPR certification.
- Three letters of recommendation. It is preferred that two of the three letters come from faculty from the applicant’s dental hygiene program.
- Evidence of completion of 2000 dental hygiene practice hours. A completed and signed form will need to be submitted with application.
- Interview. Qualified applicants will be invited to interview.
- TOEFL (or other approved test) scores for international students.
Department: College of Allied Health and Nursing
Description: The Master of Science in Advanced Dental Therapy (MSADT) is the first of its kind in the nation. This program provides access to education for licensed dental hygienists to advance their careers as dental therapists. The program is offered in a hybrid format. Most of the courses can be taken online to accommodate students anywhere in the state, nation, or world. Students attend intensive simulation and clinical skills development sessions on campus during the summer. During the second year of the program, students will practice under the supervision of a dentist at a clinical site. Graduates of the MSADT program will be eligible to be licensed as dental therapists and certified as advanced dental therapists.
Accredidation: The Advanced Dental Therapy program is accredited by the Commission on Dental Accreditation and has been granted the accreditation status of “initial accreditation.” The Commission is a specialized accrediting body recognized by the United States Department of Education. The Commission on Dental Accreditation can be contacted at (312) 440-4653 or at 211 East Chicago Avenue, Chicago, IL 60611. The Commission’s web address is: http://www.ada.org/en/coda.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Anthropology
EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required for all applicants unless the country of citizenship is on the English proficiency waiver list. Minnesota State University, Mankato accepts the following exams: TOEFL Internet-based test (iBT) with a score of 61, IELTS with an overall score of 5.5, PTE Academic with a score of 47, Duolingo with a score of 95, or completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research, applicants for regular admission to the MS in Applied Anthropology must have:

1. A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university.
2. An undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
3. 18 semester credits of undergraduate anthropology, including courses in cultural anthropology, biological anthropology, and archaeology.
4. A statement of purpose of 750 words, detailing why they are interested in the MSU Applied Anthropology program, and what their career goals are.
5. A recent sample of academic writing that demonstrates the applicant’s written communication skills.
6. Two letters of recommendation from individuals familiar with the student’s academic work.
7. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
Department: College of Humanities and Social Sciences
Description: The Master of Science in Applied Anthropology at Minnesota State University, Mankato provides students with training in the three subdisciplines of cultural anthropology, archaeology, and biological anthropology. The program is designed to provide graduates with a balance of theoretical knowledge, methodological skills, and practical experience that prepares them to apply anthropology in a variety of career settings. Students may complete either a thesis or an alternate plan paper/project. Students may also complete a Graduate Certificate in GIS while pursuing their MS degree.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Athletic Training
EnglishScore: All applicants, regardless of citizenship, must demonstrate English language proficiency. Acceptable tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT (79 with writing and speaking subscores of 20), IELTS (6.5 with writing and speaking subscores of 6.0), Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic (53), Duolingo English Test (110), or ELS Language Center (Level 112).
Requirements: Applications for the professional master's degree program will be accepted through the Athletic Training Centralized Application Service (ATCAS). The priority deadline for applications is January 15th with an anticipated program start date in June of 2024. The program will continue to accept applications after the priority deadline until the cohort is filled. The following are required for admission: Completion of a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution. Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale. Completion of prerequisite coursework with a minimum of a C or higher. 50 hours of observation with a Certified Athletic Trainer. These hours must be verified by the supervising athletic trainer. Submission of the ATCAS application which includes: Official transcripts from all institutions attended. Three letters of recommendation. At least one letter must be from a certified athletic trainer. Personal statement. Resume.
Department: College of Allied Health and Nursing
Description: The Master of Science in Athletic Training (MSAT) program is for students who want to become a certified athletic trainer and have a bachelor’s degree in a discipline other than athletic training. This professional program prepares students with the knowledge and skills necessary to prevent, assess, treat and rehabilitate injuries that happen to a physically active population. Upon graduation from the program, students are eligible to sit for the Board of Certification (BOC) exam.
Accredidation: The Athletic Training program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Athletic Training Education (CAATE).
ScholarshipType: Graduate Assistantships, Foundation Scholarships, Departmental Scholarships

ProgramName: Master of Science in Aviation
EnglishScore: For international applicants, proof of English proficiency is required. Minimum scores for graduate students are: TOEFL iBT 79 (with minimums of 17 on speaking and writing), IELTS 6.5 (with minimums of 6.0 on all subscores), PTE 58 (with minimums of 47 on all subscores), Duolingo 110, or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: A four-year baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. If an applicant does not meet the 3.0 GPA requirement they may be considered for provisional admission if they submit a satisfactory Graduate Record Examination (GRE) score report (verbal 146, quantitative 142, and analytical writing 3.0). A resume or curriculum vitae. A statement of purpose (approximately 500 words). For International Applicants, if their native language is not English, a minimum TOEFL score of 550 paper-based, 213 computer-based, or 79 internet-based (with a minimum of 17 on speaking and 18 on writing), OR a minimum IELTS score of 6.5 (with no sub score below 5.5), OR a Duolingo score of 110.
Department: College of Education, Engineering and Technology
Description: The Master of Science (MS) in Aviation is a fully online, 30-credit-hour program that is tailored to working professionals. This program is a collaboration between Minnesota State University, Mankato and Florida Institute of Technology. Students may apply to either institution and will graduate with a degree from their chosen institution. Coursework is designed to prepare graduates to advance within the aviation industry, in roles such as airline management, airport management, flight department management, aviation safety management and more.
Accredidation: The Master of Science in Aviation is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).

ProgramName: Master of Science in College Student Affairs
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following: a minimum score of 79 on the TOEFL internet-based test (iBT) with a minimum score of 17 on the speaking and writing sections; a minimum score of 6.5 on the IELTS; a minimum score of 53 on the PTE Academic; a minimum score of 110 on the Duolingo English Test; or successful completion of the ELS Language Centers level 112.
Requirements: Completed online Application for Graduate Study. Application fee. Official transcript(s) from every college or university where you have earned credit must be sent to the College of Graduate Studies and Research. GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale for the last 60 semester credits (90 quarter credits) of undergraduate coursework. A current resume. Three letters of recommendation from professional and/or academic sources who can speak to your potential for success in graduate school. You will be asked to list their names and email addresses in the online application. A two-page, double-spaced personal statement addressing the following: 1) Reasons for your interest in the College Student Affairs profession; 2) What you hope to gain from the CSA program; 3) Your potential contributions to the profession; and 4) How your identities and experiences have influenced your decision to pursue this profession. A recorded interview with three members of the CSA faculty. After a preliminary review of your application, you may be invited to complete an online interview.
Department: College of Allied Health and Nursing
Description: The College Student Affairs (CSA) program is a 40-credit master's degree program that prepares students to work in a variety of student affairs and student support roles at institutions of higher education. Student affairs professionals are dedicated to fostering holistic student success and development in postsecondary education. Students may take classes on a part-time or full-time basis, with most courses offered in the evenings in a face-to-face format to accommodate student schedules.
Accredidation: The curriculum exceeds the standards for student affairs graduate programs jointly established by the Council for the Advancement of Standards (CAS).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Communication and Media
EnglishScore: All applicants, regardless of citizenship, must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met through several options including minimum test scores on the TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo English Test, or by other means such as earning a degree from a U.S. institution or an approved English-speaking country.
Requirements: All prospective students must meet the general admission requirements of the College of Graduate Studies and Research, which are listed in the Graduate Bulletin. In addition, the Department of Communication Studies requires the following materials to be submitted for admission to the Master of Arts/Science program: Three letters of recommendation addressing your potential for successful graduate study. A 1-2 page Statement of Purpose describing your intellectual and professional goals, how these goals fit with the program at Minnesota State University, Mankato, your qualifications, and any relevant experiences. A 10-15 page writing sample that demonstrates your analytical skills, preferably a paper written for an undergraduate course. A resume or curriculum vitae. A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Applicants must meet the Minnesota State University, Mankato, College of Graduate Studies and Research requirements for admission. Generally, a grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required for full admission to a master's degree program. International Students: TOEFL score of 79 (iBT), IELTS score of 6.0, or Duolingo score of 110.
Department: College of Humanities and Social Sciences
Concentration: Strategic Communication, Communication Studies
Description: The Master of Science in Communication & Media prepares students for a wide variety of communication professions in business, industry, government, and education as well as for further graduate study. The M.S. in Communication & Media offers tracks in strategic communication and communication studies. Our curriculum blends theory and application, providing students with advanced critical thinking, research, writing, and presentation skills. Students benefit from small class sizes, personalized academic advising, and an option to complete an original thesis or a creative/professional project as a capstone experience.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Communication Sciences and Disorders
EnglishScore: International applicants must meet the university’s requirement for English language proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT: minimum score of 79 with subscores of 17 or higher; IELTS: minimum score of 6.5 with subscores of 6.0 or higher; PTE Academic: minimum score of 53 with subscores of 47 or higher; Duolingo English Test: minimum score of 110; or Completion of ELS Language Center Level 112.
Requirements: A baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution. A minimum of 3.0 undergraduate GPA (based on a 4.0 scale). The Graduate Record Exam (GRE) is not required for admission. Successful completion of prerequisite courses.
Department: College of Humanities and Social Sciences
Description: The Master of Science (M.S.) education program in speech-language pathology at Minnesota State University, Mankato is designed for students wishing to pursue careers as speech-language pathologists. Students have the opportunity to specialize in a variety of areas, including autism, school-based issues, voice, fluency, aural rehabilitation, adult neurogenics, traumatic brain injury, dysphagia, and augmentative/alternative communication. The M.S. program is a full-time, 2-year (5 semesters, including summer) program of study. Students complete a minimum of 52 credit hours of academic and clinical work.
Accredidation: The Master of Science (M.S.) education program in speech-language pathology at Minnesota State University, Mankato is accredited by the Council on Academic Accreditation in Audiology and Speech-Language Pathology of the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association, 2200 Research Boulevard, #310, Rockville, MD 20850, 800-498-2071 or 301-296-5700.
PreviousYearAcceptanceRates: 30 students enrolled out of 147 applicants for Fall 2023

ProgramName: Master of Science in Computer Engineering
EnglishScore: All applicants, regardless of citizenship, must demonstrate English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT 79 (with minimum subscores of 17), IELTS 6.5 (with minimum subscores of 6.0), PTE 58 (with minimum subscores of 47), Duolingo English Test (DET) 110, or ELS Completion of level 112.
Requirements:
Baccalaureate degree, with a major in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a closely related field from a regionally accredited U.S. university or a recognized international university, with a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
GRE general test is not required.
Statement of purpose/letter of intent (optional)
Resume/Curriculum Vitae (CV) (optional)
International Applicants must additionally provide the following items:
An official transcript translated to English of all undergraduate and graduate coursework.
Official results of English proficiency exams (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, etc.).
Please check the Graduate Studies International Student admission requirements page for more details.
Department: College of Science, Engineering and Technology
Description: The MS in Computer Engineering program prepares students for leadership roles in research, development, and design positions that require skillful and imaginative solutions to complex engineering problems. It offers a choice between a Thesis or a Coursework option. The program improves the analytical skills of students by requiring a balance of theory and application in the computer engineering area. It builds a solid foundation for those students who desire to pursue a Ph.D. degree.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Computer Science
EnglishScore: For international applicants, a minimum score of 79 on the TOEFL iBT, or 6.5 on the IELTS.
Requirements: In addition to the general College of Graduate Studies and Research application requirements, applicants must have a minimum overall undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale and the necessary background in Computer Science or a closely related field. Required application materials include a completed online application form and fee, official transcripts for all previous study, two letters of recommendation, a personal statement of purpose, and a curriculum vitae (CV)/resume. For applicants whose native language is not English, a minimum TOEFL score of 80 (with at least 17 on speaking and writing sections) or an IELTS score of 6.5 (with at least 6.0 on all bands) is required. The GRE is not required, but scores may be submitted to supplement an application.
Department: College of Science, Engineering & Technology
Description: The Master of Science program in Computer Science is designed to give the student advanced knowledge of the field and to provide an enduring foundation for future professional growth. The program blends theoretical foundations of computer science with the state-of-the-art in software and hardware technology. It is appropriate for students who wish to obtain a terminal degree as well as for those who wish to continue to a doctoral program. The program is flexible enough to accommodate both students with an undergraduate degree in computer science and students with an equivalent of a minor in computer science and a bachelor’s degree in some other field.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Computer Science and Information Technology
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit proof of English proficiency. Minimum scores accepted are TOEFL iBT 79 (with a minimum of 17 on speaking and writing sections), IELTS 6.0, PTE Academic 53, Duolingo 100, or completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements: An undergraduate degree in computer science or a closely related field from a regionally accredited college or university. An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. A grade of B or better in Data Structures and a grade of C or better in one programming course, Calculus I, and Discrete Mathematics (or their equivalents). For applicants who do not meet these requirements, they may be admitted on a provisional basis and be required to complete one or more undergraduate leveling courses before starting graduate-level coursework. International Applicants: A TOEFL score of 80 (with a minimum of 17 on speaking and writing sections), or an IELTS score of 6.5 (with a minimum of 6.0 on all bands). GRE scores are not required for admission. Application materials include an online application and fee, transcripts, a one-page statement of purpose, a current resume, and two letters of recommendation.
Department: College of Science, Engineering, and Technology
Concentration: Data Science
Description: The Master of Science in Computer Science and Information Technology program has a strong applied/research focus. Students are trained in state-of-the-art topics and are prepared for careers in the computer industry or to pursue a Ph.D. degree. The program is flexible and allows students to specialize in areas such as artificial intelligence, software engineering, databases, networking, security, etc. The graduate program also offers a data science concentration. The College of Science, Engineering and Technology has an on-campus supercomputer, which ranks as one of the largest in the region. Graduate students from a number of disciplines may have an opportunity to conduct research using the supercomputer.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Counseling and Student Personnel
EnglishScore: Official English proficiency test scores must be sent directly from the testing agency to Minnesota State University, Mankato (school code 6677). Test scores are valid for two years from the test date. Applicants can demonstrate English proficiency in any of the following ways: TOEFL iBT: 61 minimum, IELTS: 5.5 minimum overall band score, Duolingo English Test: 95 minimum, Pearson Test of English (PTE): 47 minimum, ELS Language Center: Certificate of completion of level 112.
Requirements: A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the last two years of undergraduate study is required. A GPA below 3.0 may be considered if the applicant demonstrates a strong academic history in the last two years of their undergraduate degree and/or through their statement of purpose. Application materials for the CSP master's program are to be submitted online through the College of Graduate Studies and Research application portal. Applicants must submit the following materials: College of Graduate Studies Application, Application Fee, Official Transcripts, Three Letters of Reference, Statement of Purpose, Resume. All applicants who meet minimum admissions criteria will be invited to an online interview with CSP faculty.
Department: College of Education
Concentration: ['College Student Affairs', 'Professional School Counseling']
Description: The Master of Science in Counseling and Student Personnel is a graduate program that prepares students for careers in college student affairs or school counseling. Students in the Counseling and Student Personnel program are encouraged to excel academically, professionally, and personally. The program’s mission is to prepare ethical and multiculturally competent professionals who promote the academic, career, and personal/social development of the diverse individuals, families, and communities they serve.
Accredidation: The Professional School Counseling concentration is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP). The College Student Affairs concentration is nationally recognized and follows the standards of the Council for the Advancement of Standards in Higher Education (CAS).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Criminal Justice
EnglishScore: International applicants must meet one of the following minimum requirements for admission. TOEFL Internet-based (iBT) - 79 (with minimum subscores of 17 in each of the four sections); IELTS - 6.0 (with no subscore below 5.5); PTE - 53; Duolingo English Test (DET) - 110; Successful completion of ELS Language Center's Level 112.
Requirements:
In addition to the College of Graduate Studies and Research application requirements, the Department of Sociology and Corrections requires the following:

1. Baccalaureate degree with an overall GPA of 3.0 or GPA of 3.25 on the last 60 semester credits (90 quarter credits) of undergraduate coursework.
2. Official transcript from baccalaureate degree-granting institution.
3. A minimum of three (3) letters of recommendation. Letters should be from previous college instructors who can attest to the applicant's ability to complete graduate work or from individuals who have supervised the applicant in a professional criminal justice setting. Letters should not be from relatives, friends, or coworkers.
4. A one-to-two page Statement of Purpose outlining the applicant's motivation for pursuing an M.S. in Criminal Justice at Minnesota State University, Mankato, relevant past experiences, and future career goals.
5. Resume/CV.
6. The Graduate Record Exam (GRE) is not required for admission.
Department: College of Social & Behavioral Sciences
Description: The Master of Science in Criminal Justice is designed for both pre-service students wishing to continue their education and in-service professionals looking for career advancement. The program provides the knowledge and skills necessary to critically analyze the criminal justice system and its policies; to evaluate and conduct research that addresses issues and problems in criminal justice; and to apply theoretical perspectives to crime and criminal justice issues. The degree provides excellent preparation for further graduate study in criminal justice and related fields.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Educational Administration
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate English proficiency through one of the following: an official TOEFL score of 500 (PBT) or 61 (iBT), an official IELTS score of 5.5 overall band score, an official Duolingo score of 90, an official Pearson Test of English (PTE) academic score of 47, or successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission to the Educational Leadership master's program, you must: Have earned a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited college or university. Have a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Submit an online application for admission and the non-refundable application fee to the College of Graduate Studies and Research. Submit official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. Submit a resume. Submit a goal statement (1-2 pages) that summarizes your professional background and goals, and how this program will help you meet those goals. Submit two letters of recommendation.
Department: College of Education
Concentration: Principal, Director of Special Education
Description: The Master of Science (M.S.) degree in Educational Leadership is designed for licensed teachers who wish to pursue a career in K-12 administration. The program is designed to develop aspiring principals and directors of special education into instructional leaders with the knowledge, skills and dispositions to lead in a diverse, global society. Our program curriculum is aligned to Minnesota requirements for principal and director of special education licensure as well as the National Educational Leadership Preparation (NELP) standards for building-level leaders. Courses focus on leading learning, managing school operations, navigating school law and finance, engaging communities, understanding diversity and advocating for all students. Our graduates become principals, assistant principals, deans of students, athletic directors, community education directors, directors of special education and a variety of other school leadership positions.
Accredidation: Approved by the Minnesota Professional Educator Licensing and Standards Board (PELSB). Aligned with National Educational Leadership Preparation (NELP) standards.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Educational Leadership
EnglishScore: For non-native English speakers, a score report of English proficiency is required. Minnesota State University, Mankato requires graduate students to submit official scores from one of the following tests: TOEFL iBT (61), TOEFL PBT (500), IELTS (5.5), Duolingo English Test (90), Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic (42), or ELS (109).
Requirements: To be considered for full admission, applicants must have a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution with a grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Applicants must submit a professional statement that describes their purpose in seeking a graduate degree in Educational Leadership and their philosophy of leadership, a resume of professional experience, two letters of recommendation from persons qualified to assess potential for success in a graduate program, and an essay detailing their personal leadership history. An interview may be requested.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Educational Leadership program at Minnesota State University, Mankato offers a master's degree (M.S.), a specialist degree (Ed.S.), a doctorate (Ed.D.), a principal licensure, a superintendent licensure, and a director of special education licensure. The Department of Educational Leadership is committed to developing innovative and transformative leaders through a supportive, flexible, and rigorous curriculum. The M.S. is a 34-credit program that prepares future administrators with a core of knowledge, skills and dispositions necessary to be effective as school leaders and administrators in K-12 school systems.
Accredidation: The Educational Leadership program is accredited through the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Educational Technology
EnglishScore: For applicants whose native language is not English, evidence of English proficiency is required through one of the following: TOEFL iBT score of 79 or higher (with minimum section scores of 17), IELTS score of 6.5 or higher (with no subscore below 6.0), PTE Academic score of 53 or higher (with no subscore below 47), Duolingo English Test (DET) score of 110 or higher (with minimum section scores of 95), or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: To apply to the Educational Technology MS program, you must have an undergraduate degree from an accredited institution. Applicants must meet the admission requirements of the College of Graduate Studies and Research. There is no specific undergraduate major required for admission to this program. Applicants must have earned an undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Applicants must complete the online application. In the application you will be asked to upload the following documents: 1. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. 2. Statement of Purpose. In an essay of at least 500 words, please explain: Why you want to earn this degree. What you plan to do after earning this degree. What experiences you have had with educational technology in the past. 3. Two Letters of Recommendation. Provide contact information for two people who are willing to write a letter of recommendation for you. The application system will then contact these people and ask them to upload their letter. We recommend that you contact these people ahead of time to make sure they are willing to write a letter for you. 4. Current resume. Your resume should document your post-secondary education, work experiences, and any volunteer or service activities. 5. $40 application fee.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Master of Science in Educational Technology program meets the needs of educators who wish to further develop their professional capabilities in the integration of technology into teaching and learning. The program goals include enabling educators to advance their skills in the effective use of educational technology, preparing them to assume leadership roles in their schools/districts and providing a solid foundation for those wishing to continue their graduate studies. This program is available online only. All of the programs in the department require applicants to pass a criminal background check before they may be fully admitted.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Electrical Engineering
EnglishScore: All non-native English speaking applicants are required to submit an official score from an English language proficiency examination. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT (79 with minimum section scores of 17), IELTS (6.5 with no subscore below 5.5), PTE Academic (53), Duolingo (110), or ELS Language Center (Level 112).
Requirements: An undergraduate degree in electrical engineering or a related field with a GPA of 3.0 or higher from an ABET-accredited program or a program in a school of recognized standing. Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required. If the student’s native language is not English, a minimum score of 79 on the iBT TOEFL with a minimum score of 17 on the speaking subtest, or a minimum score of 6.5 on the IELTS with a minimum score of 6.0 on the speaking subtest is required. A Statement of Purpose highlighting research interests and career goals. Students should indicate faculty members with whom they share research interests. The statement of purpose may be submitted as part of the online application. Two letters of recommendation. A resume or curriculum vitae (CV).
Department: College of Science, Engineering & Technology
Description: The Electrical and Computer Engineering Department offers a Master of Science degree in Electrical Engineering. The MSEE Program has been offered since 1984. The program of study is structured to serve both full-time and part-time students. The main objective of the program is to provide graduate students with the opportunity for advanced study and research in a number of specialty areas in electrical engineering. The MSEE program strengthens the student’s fundamental knowledge, and provides an opportunity for in-depth studies in a major field and related minor fields. The graduate courses are taught by faculty who are actively pursuing research and have developed a reputation in their areas of research expertise. The graduate program provides a balance between theory and practice, and prepares the graduate student for an advanced career in industry as well as for further study for a Ph.D. degree.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Elementary Education
EnglishScore: Graduate applicants must meet one of the following minimum requirements: TOEFL Internet-Based: 79 (with minimum subscores of 17), IELTS: 6.5 (with minimum subscores of 6.0), PTE Academic: 53, Duolingo English Test: 110, or successful completion of ELS Level 112. Waivers may be available for those who graduated from a secondary school where English is the primary language of instruction or completed 24 semester hours of academic credit from a U.S. institution.
Requirements: Admission to the graduate program in Elementary Education is based on a holistic review of the applicant's record and supporting documents. Minimum requirements for consideration for admission include: Undergraduate cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale. Personal Statement/Letter of Intent/Statement of Purpose: Submit a 1-2 page statement describing why you would like to be an elementary teacher. Include any experience you have working with children, your philosophy of education, and your professional goals. Writing Sample: Please complete and submit ONE of the following writing prompts. The response should be 2-3 pages, double spaced. 1. Describe an experience you have had working with a child from a cultural background different from your own. What did you learn from this experience? How will this experience make you a better teacher? 2. Describe an experience where you had a disagreement with a person in a position of authority over you (e.g., teacher, supervisor, coach). How did you handle the situation? What did you learn from this experience that will help you when working with students, parents, or administrators? Three Letters of Recommendation: Submit the name and email address for three references that can attest to your academic ability and your dispositions for being an effective teacher. These should include at least one faculty member from your undergraduate program and one from a supervisor in a work or volunteer setting with children. Resume/Curriculum Vitae: Submit a current resume or curriculum vitae that includes any work or volunteer experience with children.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Master of Science in Elementary Education is a 34-credit graduate program designed to meet the needs of elementary teachers who desire to continue their professional growth. Teachers will focus on reflective practice and research to gain knowledge, skills, and dispositions to make a positive impact on student learning. A K-6 academic and behavior interventionist certificate may also be earned concurrently or after completion of the degree.
Accredidation: The Elementary Education MS program is accredited under Minnesota State University, Mankato's NCATE/CAEP accreditation and by the Minnesota Professional Educator and Licensing Standards Board (PELSB).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Elementary Teaching
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit proof of English proficiency. Options include a TOEFL iBT score of 79 or higher, an IELTS score of 6.5 or higher, a PTE Academic score of 53 or higher, a Duolingo English Test score of 110 or higher, or completion of ELS Language Center Level 112.
Requirements:
In addition to the general application requirements for the College of Graduate Studies and Research, you must also submit the following items to be considered for admission:
Completed online application for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research.
Application fee.
Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. Transcripts from Minnesota State University, Mankato do not need to be requested.
Minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the last 60 credits of undergraduate coursework.
Resume that details your work history including job titles and responsibilities, education, publications and/or presentations, and other professional activities.
Goal Statement. This essay should be 2-3 pages, double spaced and should describe your reasons for pursuing a master's degree in elementary teaching, your experiences working with children from diverse backgrounds, and the personal and professional characteristics you possess that will contribute to your success as an elementary classroom teacher.
Two letters of recommendation from individuals familiar with your academic work or experience working with children (e.g., college professors, supervisors).
Department: College of Education
Description: The Elementary Teaching Master of Science is designed for people who have a bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in a major other than elementary education. The program leads to a Minnesota K-6 Elementary Teaching License. The program is offered fully online except for face-to-face field experience/student teaching. The purpose of this program is to prepare culturally responsive teachers who can work effectively in elementary schools with diverse student populations. The mission of the Department of Elementary and Literacy Education is to promote equity and excellence in education by preparing knowledgeable, reflective, and caring practitioners who are informed by theory and research.
Accredidation: The professional education programs in the College of Education at Minnesota State University, Mankato are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Engineering
EnglishScore: If your native language is not English, you must submit a valid English proficiency test score. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT (79), IELTS (6.5), Duolingo (110), PTE Academic (53), or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements:
Applicants for the Master of Science in Engineering must meet the general requirements for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research. In addition, the following criteria must be met:

1. A bachelor’s degree in engineering from an ABET-accredited institution with a GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0. Applicants with a degree in a closely related field may be admitted provisionally. Students admitted provisionally must complete the assigned prerequisite undergraduate courses with a grade of B or better.

2. For international applicants only, please refer to the English Proficiency Requirements. For Fall 2024 admissions, the GRE exam will be waived.

3. Students must complete the application for admission. The application must include the following documents:

a. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.

b. A statement of purpose describing research and career interests. The statement should be 1-2 pages in length.

c. Resume.

d. Names and email addresses of two recommenders who can speak to the applicant's ability to be successful in the program.

e. Applicants should apply by the deadlines established by the College of Graduate Studies and Research.
Department: College of Science, Engineering and Technology
Concentration: ['Automotive Engineering', 'Manufacturing Engineering', 'General Engineering', 'Engineering Management']
Description: The mission of the Master of Science in Engineering (MSE) is to serve the needs of engineers in the region and beyond by preparing them for advanced practice-oriented careers. The program will provide graduate students with advanced engineering topics in emerging cross-disciplinary areas. The faculty will mentor graduate students in conducting research projects with direct application to product development and design/process improvement, and to advance their career development.
ScholarshipAmount: Minimum stipend of $10,000 for a full-time nine-month graduate assistantship appointment.
ScholarshipType: Graduate Assistantships, University-Wide Scholarships, College/Departmental Scholarships

ProgramName: Master of Science in English
EnglishScore: International students must provide proof of English proficiency. Minnesota State Mankato accepts the following tests and scores: TOEFL iBT score of 79 (with a minimum of 17 on each section), IELTS score of 6.5 (with a minimum of 6.0 on each band), PTE Academic score of 53 (with a minimum of 47 on each section), Duolingo English Test (DET) score of 110, or successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements: In addition to the College of Graduate Studies and Research application and minimum requirements, the English M.A. program requires: a bachelor's degree with a major in English, a minimum GPA of 3.0, a statement of purpose, a writing sample, and a letter of recommendation.
Department: College of Humanities and Social Sciences
Concentration: Literature
Description: The MA in English: Literature provides students with advanced knowledge of literary history and theory and prepares them for further graduate study in literature or for careers requiring advanced literary and cultural expertise. Students pursue a broad range of interests, from ancient to contemporary literature in a variety of genres. The program culminates in a traditional research-based thesis, a creative thesis, or an alternate plan paper.
ScholarshipAmount: Departmental scholarships of $1,500 and $2,000 are available.

ProgramName: Master of Science in English Language Studies
DeadlineDate: March 1 for Fall admission; October 1 for Spring admission
EnglishScore: All applicants, regardless of citizenship, must demonstrate English language proficiency. This can be met with one of the following: a score of 79 on the internet based TOEFL (iBT) with a minimum score of 17 on the speaking and writing sections; an overall score of 6.5 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS); a score of 53 on the Pearson's Test of English Academic (PTE); a score of 110 on the Duolingo English Test (DET); or successful completion of Level 112 of the English Language for Academic Purposes Program from an ELS Language Center.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission into the Master of Science in English Language Studies program, an applicant must meet the general requirements for admission into the College of Graduate Studies and Research, and have submitted to the College of Graduate Studies and Research the following:

A statement of purpose (approximately 500 words) describing your academic and career background and goals and reasons for pursuing an MS degree in English Language Studies at Minnesota State University, Mankato.
A writing sample. It should demonstrate your best academic writing. While there are no length requirements, it should represent a significant engagement with a scholarly topic in language studies or a closely related field.
Two letters of recommendation from former professors or others familiar with your academic work. You will be asked to supply names and contact information of your recommenders during the online application process.
A curriculum vita (CV) or résumé.
Department: College of Arts and Humanities
Description: The English Language Studies M.S. focuses on developing students’ research, writing, and presentation skills within a specialized curriculum. Students will be able to apply their advanced knowledge of the English language to a variety of educational and professional contexts. The program provides advanced training for students interested in studying the English language from a variety of perspectives. In particular, it combines general and applied linguistics with literary and composition studies. The program prepares students who want to continue their graduate education and those who intend to enter the work force.
ScholarshipAmount: Full-time graduate assistants receive a stipend of $5,000 per semester.
ScholarshipPercentage: Full-time graduate assistants receive a tuition waiver of up to 9 graduate credits per semester.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Ethnic and Multi-Cultural Studies
