EnglishScore: For international students, a TOEFL score of 79 with a minimum of 17 on each subscore, an IELTS score of 6.5 with a minimum of 6.0 on each subscore, a PTE Academic score of 53, or a Duolingo score of 110.
Requirements: Completed application for graduate study. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Three letters of recommendation from former professors or others able to judge the candidate’s potential for graduate study. A statement of purpose (approximately 500 words) describing your academic interests and professional goals, how the Ethnic and Multi-Cultural Studies Master’s Program will help you achieve those goals, and your experiences that have prepared you for our program. A writing sample of no more than 15 pages in length (e.g., term paper or published article). The writing sample should demonstrate the applicant's ability to research, analyze, and write at a high level. A résumé or curriculum vitae. The GRE is not required.
Department: College of Humanities and Social Sciences
Description: The Ethnic and Multi-Cultural Studies graduate program is an interdisciplinary program that provides students with an intellectually rigorous and compassionate space for the critical study of race, ethnicity, class, gender and sexuality as they intersect and shape the lives of individuals and groups around the world. The graduate program provides students with knowledge about the interdisciplinary fields of Ethnic Studies, Gender and Women’s Studies, and LGBTQ Studies as well as a range of research methods, approaches and theories. Our curriculum focuses particularly on issues of power and social justice. Students develop the skills to analyze, articulate, and write about complex intersectional identities, systems of oppression and strategies of resistance. Students develop their particular research and professional interests through specialized courses, an internship or thesis, and an extended research project.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Ethnic Studies
EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required of all applicants whose native language is not English. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL Internet Based Test (IBT) with a score of 79 (no subscore lower than 17), IELTS with a total score of 6.5 (no subscore lower than 6.0), Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic with a score of 53 (no subscore lower than 47), Duolingo English Test with a score of 110, or completion of ELS Level 112 with a 2.5 GPA.
Requirements:
In addition to the College of Graduate Studies and Research application requirements, applicants must have a bachelor’s degree from a regionally-accredited college or university and must have a minimum 3.0 undergraduate GPA (on a 4.0 scale). The Department of Ethnic Studies has a holistic application review process. The department will consider applicants who do not meet the minimum undergraduate GPA if the other components of their application are strong. Applicants must submit the following:

*   A statement of purpose of about 500 words describing the applicant’s academic interests and goals, and how they relate to the Ethnic Studies program.
*   A writing sample of about 10-15 pages (e.g., a paper for an undergraduate course) that demonstrates the applicant’s writing and analytical skills.
*   Names and contact information of three references who can attest to the applicant’s academic abilities. (The system will then contact them for a letter of recommendation.)
Department: College of Humanities and Social Sciences
Description: The Ethnic Studies master's program at Minnesota State University, Mankato is the oldest and only stand-alone graduate program in the state and region. We are an innovative, interdisciplinary, and critical program committed to social justice. Our program is nationally-recognized for its excellence and for producing outstanding students that have gone on to doctoral programs and to work in a variety of fields including student affairs, non-profit management, and community organizing. We offer a 30-credit thesis plan and a 34-credit alternate plan paper/creative project. Our curriculum explores the intersections of race, class, gender, and sexuality with a focus on African American, American Indian, Asian American and Latinx Studies. Students are encouraged to develop their own area of emphasis. Recent graduate research has examined environmental racism, social movements, indigenous education, hip hop culture, and critical mixed-race studies.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Exercise Physiology
EnglishScore: You are required to submit proof of English proficiency. You can meet this requirement in any one of the following ways: TOEFL iBT: 61 or higher, IELTS: 6.0 or higher, Duolingo English Test: 95 or higher, PTE Academic: 47 or higher, ELS: Successful completion of Level 112 from an ELS Language Center in the United States.
Requirements: A four-year baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution. A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Completed prerequisite coursework: Human Anatomy and Physiology I and II with labs; Chemistry I and II with labs; College Algebra; Physics I and II with labs; Exercise Physiology with lab; Biomechanics with lab; Statistics. The GRE is not required. International students must have a minimum TOEFL score of 80 with a minimum of 17 on each of the speaking and writing sections; OR IELTS score of 6.5 with a minimum of 6.0 on each of the speaking and writing sections; OR Duolingo score of 110.
Department: College of Allied Health and Nursing
Description: The Master of Science degree in Exercise Physiology is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the physiological responses and adaptations to exercise. The curriculum is divided into two parts: a 21-credit core curriculum and a 12-credit choice of either a thesis or alternate plan paper (APP) research option. Students will be well-prepared to successfully take one or both of the top two certifications in the field through the American College of Sports Medicine (ACSM), the Certified Exercise Physiologist (EP-C) and the Certified Clinical Exercise Physiologist (CEP). This program prepares students for a variety of careers in academic, clinical, corporate, and athletic settings, or for further graduate study in doctoral or other professional programs.
Accredidation: The graduate program in Exercise Physiology at Minnesota State University, Mankato is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (www.caahep.org) upon the recommendation of the Committee on Accreditation for the Exercise Sciences (CoAES).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Exercise Science
EnglishScore: All international applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency. Accepted methods include TOEFL iBT: 61 (with subscores of 15 for writing and speaking), IELTS: 6.0 (with no sub-score less than 5.0), Duolingo English Test (DET): 95, Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic: 47, or ELS Level 112 completion.
Requirements: Completed Application for Admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research. A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the most recent 60 semester credits of undergraduate coursework, which must include at least 15 credits of 300- or 400-level coursework. A curriculum vitae or resume detailing educational background, work experience, research experience, professional activities and affiliations, publications, and presentations. A statement of purpose (1-2 pages) that describes a) your educational and professional background, b) your educational and professional goals and how this degree will help you achieve them, and c) faculty with whom you may be interested in working. Three letters of recommendation submitted from individuals familiar with your academic and professional abilities. A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university in exercise science or related field. Completion of the following prerequisites or their equivalents with a C or better: Human Anatomy, Human Physiology, Exercise Physiology, Biomechanics, English Composition, Statistics. Note that students may be admitted conditionally if they have not yet completed all prerequisites. In such cases, all prerequisites must be completed within the first two semesters of enrollment.
Department: College of Allied Health and Nursing
Description: The Master of Science in Exercise Science provides an opportunity for students to acquire cognitive knowledge, research tools, and laboratory skills in preparation for careers in the exercise sciences as well as for entrance into post-graduate studies (e.g. physical therapy, occupational therapy, medical school, Ph.D. programs). The program prepares students as scientists and practitioners who are able to apply scientific principles to the study of human movement in both clinical and athletic settings. The program is flexible in that it allows students to take courses in several different areas based on their interests. With the guidance of an advisor, students create a program of study in areas such as exercise physiology, clinical exercise physiology, cardiac rehabilitation, biomechanics, and strength and conditioning. The MS in Exercise Science is completed with either a thesis or an alternate plan paper. Our program provides ample opportunities for hands-on research and applied experiences. Students have the opportunity to work alongside faculty on a variety of research topics. These experiences often lead to presentations at regional and national conferences, as well as publications in peer-reviewed scientific journals. The program works closely with Campus Recreation, the Maverick Sports Medicine Program, and local partners to offer a number of graduate assistantships. Students have an opportunity to participate in hands-on clinical and sport performance experiences through the Human Performance Lab. Students can gain experience by: Working with patients in our Phase II Cardiac Rehabilitation program. Performing exercise testing (e.g., VO2max, anaerobic power, etc.) on athletes and general population clients. Working with athletes in the Maverick Sports Performance Program. Performing body composition assessments (e.g., DEXA, BodPod, skinfolds). Participating in community engagement activities, such as health and fitness fairs.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Gender and Women's Studies
EnglishScore: Proof of English Proficiency is required for all students whose native language is not English, regardless of their citizenship. Students may be exempt from this requirement if they have received a baccalaureate or graduate degree from a college or university in the United States, United Kingdom, Ireland, English-speaking Canada, Anglophone Africa, Anglophone Caribbean, Australia, or New Zealand.
Requirements:
Applicants must meet the College of Graduate Studies and Research’s admission requirements. In addition, the applicant must also submit the following directly to the College of Graduate Studies and Research:

A bachelor’s degree from an accredited university.
An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher.
A statement of purpose (1-2 pages) that describes a) your educational and career goals and how the M.S. in Gender and Women’s Studies will help you to reach them and b) your familiarity with gender and women’s studies and topics you hope to research.
A writing sample (8-10 pages) that demonstrates your analytical and writing abilities. You may submit an essay from an undergraduate course.
A resume/curriculum vita.
Names and contact information of three recommenders. Recommenders will be contacted by the university with instructions for submitting a letter of recommendation. We prefer at least one recommender to be a professor who can speak to your academic abilities.
Department: College of Humanities and Social Sciences
Description: The Master of Science degree in Gender and Women's Studies is an interdisciplinary program designed to provide students with a deep understanding of the complex ways in which gender and other social identity categories shape the human experience. The program provides a substantial and rigorous course of study that enables students to critically examine gender as it intersects with other categories of difference such as race, ethnicity, class, sexuality, and disability. The graduate program also trains students to apply intersectional feminist analysis to a variety of social issues and problems. The program prepares students for a variety of careers in human services, advocacy, education, non-profit organizations, and social justice activism. It also prepares students who wish to pursue a doctoral degree. Gender and Women's Studies offers two capstone options for students: thesis and alternate plan paper (APP).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Geography
LiveDate: Applications are accepted up to one year in advance of the semester for which you are applying. For Fall 2026, this would be approximately August 2025.
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency through one of the following: TOEFL minimum score of 79 iBT (with a minimum of 17 on speaking and 18 on writing) or 550 PBT; IELTS minimum score of 6.5; PTE Academic minimum score of 53; Duolingo English Test minimum score of 110; Completion of ELS Language Centers level 112.
Requirements:
A bachelor's degree from an accredited university.
A GPA of 3.0 or higher.
The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is NOT required.
At least 12 semester credits in Geography or a related field.
A personal statement of career goals and research interests.
Three letters of recommendation.
International applicants must also provide results of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) as part of their application. A minimum iBT score of 79, with minimum subscores of 17 on the Writing and Speaking sections is required for admission to the College of Graduate Studies.
Department: College of Social and Behavioral Sciences
Description: The Master of Science in Geography is a versatile degree, designed to meet the career needs of students from a wide array of undergraduate backgrounds. With thesis and alternate plan paper options, the program offers a graduate-level curriculum that includes a wide array of courses covering the major sub-fields of geography. This degree option can also serve students seeking a PhD in Geography. A Master of Science in Geography also prepares students to enter the job market with an advanced set of geographical and technical skills.

ProgramName: Master of Science in History
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency. Minimum scores: TOEFL iBT 79 (with minimums of 17 in speaking and 18 in writing), IELTS 6.5 (with minimums of 6.0 in speaking and writing), PTE Academic 58 (with minimums of 47 in speaking and 53 in writing), Duolingo English Test (DET) 110, or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: In addition to the general requirements for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research, applicants for admission to the Master of Science program in History must have a cumulative undergraduate grade point average of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Applicants must submit a writing sample of at least five pages in length, a statement of purpose, and two letters of recommendation from former professors. All materials will be evaluated by the History Department's graduate committee. Graduate Record Exam (GRE) scores are NOT required for admission to the program.
Department: College of Social and Behavioral Sciences
Concentration: U.S. History, European History, Non-Western History
Description: The Master of Science in History provides students with an advanced understanding of the human past. The program is designed to meet the needs of a wide range of students, from those who want to teach in community colleges, to those who want to enhance their careers as high school teachers, to those who plan to pursue a PhD in history. Students may tailor their programs of study to fit their academic and career interests. All students complete a common core of courses that introduce them to the practice of history at the graduate level. Students then work with their advisors to develop an area of concentration in either U.S., European, or non-western history and a minor field. Students have the option of completing their program with a thesis, an alternate plan paper, or a comprehensive written exam.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Information Technology
EnglishScore:
International applicants who are non-native English speakers must submit evidence of English proficiency by providing one of the following:

a minimum score of 79 on the internet-based Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL)
a minimum score of 6.5 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS)
a minimum score of 110 on the Duolingo English Test
a minimum score of 53 on the Pearson Test of English (PTE Academic)
successful completion of the Minnesota State University, Mankato's Intensive English Program (IEP).
Requirements: A four-year baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. A completed online application. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. A Statement of Purpose. Resume. Two letters of recommendation. For non-native English speakers, an official TOEFL score report with a minimum score of 79 or an official IELTS score of 6.0. GRE is not required.
Department: College of Science, Engineering and Technology
Description: The Master of Science in Information Technology (MSIT) program at Minnesota State University, Mankato is a 30-credit graduate program that prepares students for advanced careers in the dynamic and ever-evolving field of information technology. The MSIT program is designed for individuals who have an aptitude for applying computing to business problems. The program is specifically designed to bridge the gap between information technology and business, giving students a unique blend of technical and management skills. Students enrolled in the MSIT program benefit from an innovative curriculum and state-of-the-art facilities. They have access to courses in areas such as software engineering, database management, project management, business intelligence and data analytics. Students can also specialize their degree through a choice of electives, which allows them to explore their individual interests and career goals. Throughout the program, students have numerous opportunities to participate in real-world projects and internships, which provides them with hands-on experience and a chance to build their professional network. Graduates of the MSIT program are well-equipped to take on leadership roles in the IT industry. They possess the knowledge, skills, and experience to design, develop, and manage complex IT systems, and they are prepared to tackle the challenges of the rapidly changing technological landscape. Our graduates go on to successful careers in a variety of industries, including healthcare, finance, manufacturing, and consulting.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Manufacturing Engineering Technology
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT score of at least 79 (with a minimum of 17 on each of the four sections), TOEFL paper-based test score of at least 550, IELTS Academic score of 6.0 (with a minimum of 5.5 in each of the four modules), PTE Academic score of 53 (with a minimum of 47 in each of the four sections), Duolingo English Test (DET) score of 110, or ELS Language Center's Level 112 with a grade of B or higher.
Requirements:
The requirements for admission to the Master of Science in Manufacturing Engineering Technology program are:
A four-year bachelor's degree in Engineering Technology or related field with a GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 from an accredited university or college.
Official transcripts of all previous undergraduate and graduate work.
A statement of purpose (500-1000 words).
The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is NOT required for admission to the MSMET program.
A list of three references with full contact information.
Department: College of Science, Engineering and Technology
Concentration: mechatronics, lean manufacturing, or quality management
Description: The Manufacturing Engineering Technology program provides students with the advanced skills to develop and transform new materials into products. The curriculum provides a broad background in manufacturing processes, lean manufacturing, quality control, digital manufacturing, robotics, automation, and manufacturing management. The program offers a hands-on learning environment where students apply their learning to real-world projects. Students will also be able to work with state-of-the-art software and tools in their coursework. The program requires 30-34 graduate credits depending on the student’s choice of completing a thesis or an alternate plan paper. Students can choose a specialization in mechatronics, lean manufacturing, or quality management.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Math and Stats
EnglishScore: All applicants, regardless of citizenship, must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met with: a minimum TOEFL score of 79 iBT (with a minimum of 17 on speaking and 17 on writing sections), a minimum IELTS score of 6.5, a minimum Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic score of 53, a minimum Duolingo English Test score of 110, or successful completion of ELS Language Center level 112.
Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research, applicants for admission to the Master of Science program in Mathematics and Statistics must have:
1. A completed Application for Graduate Study.
2. A $40 non-refundable application fee.
3. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. Transcripts from Minnesota State Mankato do not need to be submitted.
4. One official letter of recommendation. Recommenders must be familiar with the applicant’s academic work. The recommender should address the following: work ethic, perseverance, ability to work independently, and ability to handle abstract concepts. Recommenders should submit the letter through the online application system.
5. An undergraduate degree in mathematics, statistics, or a related field with at least a 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale.
6. A statement of purpose outlining the applicant's mathematical and statistical background, interests, and professional goals.
7. GRE scores are optional.
Department: College of Science, Engineering and Technology
Concentration: ['Mathematics Emphasis', 'Applied Statistics Emphasis']
Description: Minnesota State Mankato's Mathematics and Statistics M.S. program features a large and diverse faculty offering a broad spectrum of advanced topics. The flexible curriculum is tailored to the student's career objectives and is ideal for working professionals. Students also gain experience using sophisticated mathematical and statistical software. Choose a Thesis Plan or an Alternate Plan Paper. Research and scholarly activities abound. Students often present their scholarly work at regional conferences.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Mental Health Counseling
EnglishScore: All applicants, regardless of citizenship, must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met with a TOEFL score of 79 on the iBT (with a minimum of 17 on speaking and 17 on writing) or 550 on the PBT; an IELTS score of 6.5 (with no sub score below 5.5); a Duolingo English Test score of 110; or a Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic score of 53.
Requirements: Applicants must complete the Graduate Studies application, pay the application fee, and submit official transcripts. A cumulative undergraduate grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required for full admission status. Required documents include three letters of recommendation, a 2-3 page Statement of Purpose, and a current resume. GRE scores are not required for admission. After a preliminary screening of all completed application files, selected applicants will be invited to a required on-campus interview.
Department: College of Education

ProgramName: Master of Science in Parks, Recreation and Leisure Studies
EnglishScore: All international applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency. This can be met by providing official scores from one of the following exams: TOEFL iBT, IELTS, PTE Academic, or Duolingo English Test. Proficiency can also be demonstrated by having attended a U.S. college or university for at least three years full-time and earning a bachelor's degree, or by successfully completing Level 112 of the ELS Language Centers program.
Requirements:
To apply to the Master of Science degree in Recreation, Parks and Leisure Studies, you need:
A completed Application for Graduate Study.
A baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited college or university.
A GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. (Students with a GPA between 2.7 and 2.99 may be considered for provisional admission).
Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
Two letters of recommendation.
A statement of purpose. This statement should address your background, interests, and goals related to the field of recreation, parks and leisure studies.
A current resume.
A score of 500 on the paper-based test, or 173 on the computer-based test, or 61 on the internet-based test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) for all non-native English speakers.
An interview with a RPLS graduate faculty member may be required.
Department: College of Allied Health and Nursing
Description: The Recreation, Parks, and Leisure Services department is committed to educating professionals who enhance the quality of life for all people through the provision of recreation, parks, and leisure services. The Department of Recreation, Parks, and Leisure Services at Minnesota State Mankato is a nationally recognized leader and is one of the largest and most established programs in the United States. We seek students who are excited to grow as leaders and committed to becoming outstanding professionals.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Reading
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting one of the following: TOEFL iBT: 79 (with a minimum of 17 on speaking and writing sections); IELTS: 6.5 (with no subscore below 5.5); PTE Academic: 53 (with no subscore below 47); Duolingo English Test: 110; Successful completion of the Minnesota State University, Mankato Intensive English Program (IEP).
Requirements: A bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited college or university. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. A completed online Graduate Application. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. A current resume. Two letters of recommendation from individuals familiar with your academic or professional background. A personal statement of 500-700 words addressing your professional goals and how this program will help you achieve them. GRE scores may be waived with a GPA of 3.25 or higher or a previously earned Master's degree.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Master of Science in Reading program is designed to meet the Minnesota requirements for the K-12 Reading Teacher license and to prepare reading specialists for a variety of educational settings. All graduate students seeking a Master of Science in Reading will gain expertise in literacy processes and instruction for all students, including those who are culturally and linguistically diverse. Students receive advanced preparation in literacy foundations, theory, research, assessment and instruction. The program emphasizes the use of evidence-based practices to develop, implement, and evaluate literacy instruction. It is grounded in a socio-psycholinguistic and sociocultural perspective of literacy that focuses on comprehension as the center of all reading and writing processes. The M.S. in Reading has two options: Option 1: K-12 Reading Teacher Licensure & Option 2: Non-Licensure. The M.S. in Reading is a fully online program. Students may be admitted any term. All coursework is designed to support practicing educators. Assignments are job-embedded and require access to K-12 students. Most students take 1-2 courses per term and complete the program in two years.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Special Education
EnglishScore: All applicants for admission to a graduate program must provide evidence of English language proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT - 79 (with 17 on speaking and writing sections), IELTS - 6.5 (with no band below 6.0), PTE Academic - 53, Duolingo - 110, TOEFL PBT - 550, or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: To be admitted to the Master of Science in Special Education degree program, an applicant must have a baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited college or university. Applicants must also submit the following to the College of Graduate Studies and Research: 1. An application for graduate study. 2. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. A GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required for full admission. Applicants with a GPA lower than 3.0 must submit Graduate Record Exam (GRE) scores. 3. Three letters of recommendation. 4. A letter of application/personal statement indicating interest and abilities for working with exceptional individuals. 5. International students should also refer to the additional requirements at the College of Graduate Studies website.
Department: College of Education
Concentration: ['Academic & Behavioral Strategist (ABS)', 'Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD)', 'Developmental Disabilities (DD)', 'Emotional/Behavioral Disorders (EBD)', 'Learning Disabilities (LD)']
Description: The Master of Science (MS) degree in Special Education is designed to develop leaders in special education who possess the knowledge and skills to improve the lives of individuals with disabilities. The MS degree will prepare you to work in schools, community-based programs, residential treatment centers, and other settings where services are provided to children and youth with disabilities. Our programs also may lead to a Minnesota teaching license. Minnesota State Mankato's Special Education Master's degree is a 34-credit program. If you are seeking initial or additional licensure, your credit total may exceed 34 credits.
Accredidation: Accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)
ScholarshipType: Merit-based, Need-based, Major-specific, Leadership, Community service

ProgramName: Master of Science in Special Education and Teaching
EnglishScore: All applicants for graduate study, regardless of citizenship, must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting official test scores from TOEFL iBT (minimum score of 79 with subscores of 17 in Speaking and 17 in Writing), IELTS (minimum score of 6.5 with no subscore below 5.5), Pearson Test of English (PTE) (minimum score of 53), Duolingo English Test (minimum score of 110), or successful completion of ELS Language Center Level 112.
Requirements:
In addition to the College of Graduate Studies and Research admission requirements, applicants must also meet the following program requirements:
1. Complete an application for admission.
2. Pay the application fee.
3. Provide an official transcript from the institution that awarded your bachelor's degree. We reserve the right to request all transcripts.
4. Applicants must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Applicants not meeting the 3.0 GPA requirement may be admitted provisionally.
5. A one-page typed letter of intent/goal statement explaining your reasons for pursuing a master’s degree in special education.
6. Two letters of recommendation from individuals able to attest to your ability to do graduate-level work.
7. A writing sample using the provided prompt.
8. A Minnesota Teaching License is not required for admission into the program but will be necessary to obtain a special education teaching license.
Department: College of Education
Concentration: Academic Behavioral Strategist (ABS), Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD), Special Education MS (non-licensure)
Description: The Master of Science in Special Education and Teaching is a fully online graduate degree program in special education that provides advanced professional training for special educators and other professionals working with individuals with disabilities. The program offers tracks for candidates seeking initial licensure in special education or for those who are already licensed in the field and are seeking an advanced degree. Special education licenses are offered in Academic Behavioral Strategist (ABS) and Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD).
Accredidation: The College of Education at Minnesota State University, Mankato is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). This program is also approved by the Minnesota Professional Educator Licensing and Standards Board (PELSB).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Technical Communication
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency. Minnesota State Mankato accepts the following tests and minimum scores: TOEFL iBT (79), IELTS Academic (6.5), Duolingo English Test (110), PTE Academic (53), or ELS Language Centers (Level 112).
Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements for admission to the College of Graduate Studies and Research, applicants for admission to the Master of Science in Technical Communication program are required to have:
1. A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university.
2. A minimum grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the last two years of undergraduate coursework.
3. Non-native English speakers must meet the University's English language proficiency requirements.
In order to be considered for admission to the program, applicants must submit the following materials:
1. Completed Application for Admission to Graduate Study.
2. Application fee.
3. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
4. Two letters of recommendation from individuals such as professors or employers who are in a position to evaluate the applicant's potential for graduate study in technical communication.
5. Statement of purpose indicating why you are seeking a degree in technical communication.
6. Resume or curriculum vita.
7. Writing sample of no more than 15 pages that demonstrates your potential for success in a graduate program in technical communication.
The GRE is not required for admission to the program.
Department: College of Arts and Humanities
Description: The Master of Science in Technical Communication program offers a comprehensive curriculum that prepares students for careers in the dynamic and growing field of technical communication. This program is designed to equip students with the advanced skills and knowledge needed to effectively communicate complex technical information to diverse audiences. Key areas of focus include user experience (UX) design, content strategy, instructional design, information architecture, and digital media production. Students will learn to create and manage various forms of technical content, such as user manuals, online help systems, training materials, and website content. The program emphasizes a hands-on, project-based learning approach, allowing students to build a professional portfolio that showcases their abilities. Graduates are well-prepared for leadership roles in industries such as software development, healthcare, engineering, and education, working as technical writers, content strategists, UX researchers, instructional designers, and information architects.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Teaching: Elementary Education
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency through one of the following: a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 79 (with a minimum of 17 on speaking and writing sections), a minimum IELTS score of 6.5 (with no band below 6.0), a minimum PTE Academic score of 53, a minimum Duolingo English Test score of 110, or completion of Level 112 in the ELS Language Centers program.
Requirements: Undergraduate degree from a regionally accredited college or university. Undergraduate cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. If undergraduate GPA is below 3.0, applicant may be considered for provisional admission based on a combination of other factors, including: GPA in last 60 credits, GPA in major, work experience, etc. An admission essay will be required. Required Application Materials: Official transcript(s) from all post-secondary institutions attended. Resume highlighting relevant experiences. Personal Statement explaining applicant's reasons for pursuing this degree, including relevant personal and professional experiences. In addition, the statement should describe the applicant's plan for success in a graduate program, especially related to the online environment. Two letters of recommendation from professional or academic references who can speak to your potential for success in a graduate program and in the field of education.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Master of Science in Teaching (MST) Elementary Education is a rigorous and highly-esteemed program for individuals who have previously earned a bachelor’s degree in a field other than education and who wish to become an elementary classroom teacher. The MST program has a hybrid delivery, on-campus in Mankato or online. Upon successful completion of the program, students graduate with a Master of Science in Teaching degree and an initial Minnesota teaching license to teach children in grades kindergarten through sixth (K-6). The program requires 36 graduate credits for the master's degree and can be completed in as little as 15 months (one summer and two semesters).
Accredidation: Minnesota State University, Mankato is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission. All educator preparation programs are accredited by the Minnesota Professional Educator Licensing and Standards Board (PELSB). In addition, the college is a member of the American Association of Colleges of Teacher Education (AACTE) and programs are reviewed by a number of specialized professional organizations. We are currently a CAEP candidate for accreditation.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Teaching: K-12 and Secondary Programs
EnglishScore: Students for whom English is not their native language must provide proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT score of 79 or higher (with a minimum of 17 on speaking and 17 on writing), or a PBT score of 550; IELTS overall score of 6.5 or higher (with no sub score below 5.5); PTE Academic overall score of 53 or higher (with no sub score below 47); Duolingo English Test score of 110 or higher; ELS Language Center's Level 112.
Requirements:
To be admitted to the K-12 and Secondary Graduate Teacher Licensure program and/or Master of Science in Teaching program, a prospective student must meet the following minimum admission requirements:

1. Complete the Minnesota State University, Mankato Graduate Studies Application.
2. Pay the application fee.
3. Submit official transcripts from all previous undergraduate and graduate institutions. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required for the last 60 credits of undergraduate coursework.
4. Submit official scores from the Minnesota Teacher Licensure Exam (MTLE) basic skills tests (Reading, Writing, and Mathematics) OR official ACT Plus Writing, SAT, or GRE test scores.
5. Submit an original written essay, not to exceed two double-spaced pages, responding to the prompt available in the Graduate Studies application system.
6. Submit a resume outlining your education, work, and volunteer experience.
7. Three letters of recommendation addressing your potential for success in a graduate program and potential as a future teacher.
8. A successful interview with faculty from the licensure area to which you are applying. You will be contacted to arrange an interview after all other application materials are received.
Department: College of Education
Concentration: ['Academic and Behavioral Strategist', 'Art Education', 'Chemistry', 'Communication Arts and Literature', 'Dance', 'Developmental Disabilities', 'Early Childhood Education', 'Earth and Space Science', 'Elementary Education', 'English as a Second Language', 'Health', 'Instrumental Music', 'Life Science', 'Mathematics', 'Physical Education', 'Physics', 'Social Studies', 'Spanish', 'Vocal Music', 'World Languages and Cultures']
Description:
The Master of Science in Teaching (MST) degree is designed for individuals who hold an undergraduate degree in a discipline other than education and wish to pursue a teaching license and a master's degree simultaneously. Candidates pursue one of the following licensure areas and complete coursework in that licensure area in addition to foundational coursework and a final research project.
Program Highlights:
- Flexible learning formats (online, on campus, hybrid)
- Licensure-only option
- Part-time or full-time enrollment
- Financial aid available
- Master's degree may lead to a salary increase
- Dedicated faculty advisors
Accredidation: All of our educator preparation programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) and approved by the Minnesota Professional Educator Licensing and Standards Board (PELSB).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Teaching: Special Education
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT score of 79, IELTS score of 6.5, PTE Academic score of 53, or Duolingo English Test score of 110. Successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 112 is also accepted. Waivers may be granted based on previous education in an English-speaking country.
Requirements: GPA: 3.0. A completed bachelor's degree in any field. Official transcripts from all institutions attended. A letter explaining why you are interested in becoming a Special Education teacher (this will serve as a writing sample). A resume listing educational and work experiences. One letter of recommendation that can speak to applicant's character, work ethic, and ability to be successful in the program. International Applicants must also meet the international graduate student requirements.
Department: College of Education
Concentration: Academic and Behavioral Strategist (ABS)
Description: The Master of Science in Teaching (MST): Special Education is a 34-credit online graduate program designed for individuals who hold a bachelor’s degree in a field other than education who wish to become a licensed special education teacher in Minnesota in the area of Academic and Behavioral Strategist (ABS). Graduates of this program will be well-prepared to serve K-12 students with a broad range of mild to moderate disabilities (learning disabilities, emotional and behavioral disorders, developmental cognitive disabilities, other health disabilities, and autism spectrum disorders).

ProgramName: Master of Social Work (MSW)
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency by submitting one of the following: TOEFL iBT minimum score of 79 (with minimum subscores: writing 20, speaking 20), IELTS minimum score of 6.5 (with no subscore below 6.0), PTE Academic minimum score of 53 (with minimum subscores: reading 51, listening 51, speaking 53, writing 56), Duolingo minimum score of 110, or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission into the Traditional MSW Program, students must have the following: A baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited college or university. A degree in any field is acceptable for the traditional program. A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the last two years of the undergraduate degree OR an overall GPA of 2.75. Liberal arts background including course content in social and behavioral sciences, humanities, and biological sciences. Demonstrated commitment to social work values. A graduate application to the College of Graduate Studies and Research (separate from the MSW application). Applicants who meet the admission criteria will be invited for a required interview. Interviews are conducted by faculty and community members. Students must have completed an undergraduate statistics course with a grade of C or better within five years prior to admission. An undergraduate research methods course is also recommended.
Department: College of Allied Health and Nursing
Description: The Master of Social Work (MSW) Program is a professional degree that provides advanced social work knowledge and skills to students. The program is designed to develop students’ commitment to social work values and ethics, and to prepare them for advanced generalist social work practice with individuals, families, small groups, organizations, and communities. The MSW Program is committed to preparing social workers who will provide services that are responsive to the needs of the diverse populations of Minnesota and the surrounding region. The program emphasizes the provision of services in a rural human service environment and is committed to promoting human rights and social, racial, economic and environmental justice.
Accredidation: The Minnesota State University, Mankato Master of Social Work program is fully accredited by the Council on Social Work Education’s Commission on Accreditation.

ProgramName: Professional Science Master's in Computer Science and Information Technology
EnglishScore: International applicants must meet the university's English proficiency requirements. Accepted tests include TOEFL iBT (79 or higher with subscores of 17 or higher), IELTS (6.5 or higher with all subscores of 6.0 or higher), Duolingo (110 or higher), or Pearson Test of English (PTE) (53 or higher). Completion of the university's Intensive English Program or ELS Language Center's Level 112 are also accepted.
Requirements: Applicants for admission to the PSM in CSIT must meet the general requirements of the College of Graduate Studies and Research and also have at least an undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a closely-related field. They also need to have successfully completed undergraduate courses in calculus I, discrete mathematics, data structures, and object-oriented programming with a grade of at least C. To apply, the applicant should submit the following: 1. A completed graduate application form. 2. One official transcript from each college and university attended. 3. A statement of purpose about career goals and reasons for applying to this program. 4. A resume. 5. Two letters of recommendation. 6. An undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0 out of 4.0. 7. A test score of English proficiency (for international students only).
Department: College of Science, Engineering and Technology
Concentration: ['Computer Science', 'Information Technology']
Description: The Professional Science Master's (PSM) in Computer Science and Information Technology is a 30-credit graduate program that prepares students for rewarding careers in the fast-paced technology sector. This program offers a unique blend of technical expertise and professional skills, making graduates highly sought-after by employers. The PSM in CSIT program has two emphasis areas, Computer Science and Information Technology, each with a required internship course.

ProgramName: Specialist in Educational Leadership
Requirements:
The application for graduate study at Minnesota State University, Mankato is completed online through the College of Graduate Studies and Research. The application process is selective, admitting only those students who have demonstrated the potential to be successful educational leaders. We review the total application for evidence of this potential.

The application requires the following:

Application form and fee
Official transcripts must be sent to the College of Graduate Studies and Research directly from the institution
Personal statement
Resume/curriculum vitae
Three letters of recommendation
A current copy of your Minnesota teaching license (Superintendent & Director of Special Education applicants)
A copy of your Minnesota principal license (K-12 Principal applicants)
A copy of your principal license or evidence of completed coursework (Superintendent applicants)
The Educational Leadership Department at Minnesota State University, Mankato does not require the GRE for admission to its graduate programs.

The College of Graduate Studies and Research requires a minimum GPA of 3.0 for admission.
Department: College of Education
Concentration: K-12 Principal, Superintendent, Director of Special Education
Description: The Specialist Degree in Educational Leadership is for those students who want to become a licensed principal, superintendent, and/or director of special education. The program has three strands of licensure: K-12 Principal, Superintendent, and Director of Special Education. It is a 34-credit program beyond a master’s degree. Students may pursue licensure in a single area or in a combination of areas. The Specialist program is also intended for those who already have a principal license and want to earn their superintendent and/or director of special education license.
Accredidation: The Educational Leadership programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) and approved by the Minnesota Professional Educator Licensing and Standards Board (PELSB).

ProgramName: Doctor of Education in Educational Leadership
EnglishScore: All applicants, regardless of citizenship, must demonstrate English language proficiency. Acceptable exams and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT score of 79 with a minimum speaking subscore of 20 and a minimum writing subscore of 20; IELTS score of 6.5 with no subscore below 6.0; PTE score of 53 with no subscore below 53; Duolingo English Test score of 110.
Requirements:
Completed Online Application
Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. Transcripts must be sent from the institutions directly to the College of Graduate Studies and Research.
A current résumé that describes professional accomplishments and community involvement.
A personal statement/essay of no more than three double-spaced pages describing:
    The applicant’s interest in the doctoral program.
    How the applicant’s professional goals align with the program.
    What the applicant brings to the program and to the cohort.
    The applicant’s perceptions about his/her greatest challenges in beginning a rigorous doctoral program and how s/he might respond to those challenges.
Three letters of recommendation attesting to the applicant’s leadership skills and potential for success in a doctoral program. One letter must be from a current supervisor. One must be from a faculty member who can attest to the applicant's potential for academic success in a doctoral program.
A scholarly writing sample of which you are the sole author. Examples include, but are not limited to, a master’s thesis or paper, a published article, or a grant proposal.
Applicants must have a Master's degree from a regionally accredited institution.
A minimum graduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required. In some circumstances, applicants with a graduate GPA below 3.0 may be considered for provisional admission.
Evidence of successful leadership experience.
Successful completion of a screening interview with department faculty.
Department: College of Education
Description:
Minnesota State University, Mankato’s Ed.D. in Educational Leadership program is designed for P-12 educational leaders. The program aims to prepare skilled, ethical and socially responsible leaders who can create and renew educational settings that promote learning, development, and achievement for all students. Cohorts for the program begin each summer.

Graduates of the program will be able to:
1. Conduct and consume quantitative, qualitative and mixed methods research for data-driven decision making.
2. Understand and respond to the complex issues impacting diverse communities in the 21st century.
3. Apply ethical frameworks to the practice of educational leadership.
4. Communicate with clarity, purpose, and sophistication in written, oral, and digital forms.
5. Demonstrate advanced proficiency in leadership through an individually designed residency/internship.
6. Examine and apply current and emerging theory to issues of school system practice.

ProgramName: Doctorate in Educational Administration
EnglishScore: All international applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT score of 79 (with minimum subscores of 17 in Speaking and Writing), IELTS score of 6.5 (with minimum subscores of 6.0 in Speaking and Writing), PTE Academic score of 58 (with minimum subscores of 47 in Speaking and Writing), Duolingo English Test (DET) score of 110, or completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Requirements: Completed online application. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. Copy of current administrative license or verification of eligibility for a license. Documentation of a minimum of three years of licensed administrative experience. Current resume or vita. Statement of professional and scholarly goals. Writing sample: A three-page (maximum), double-spaced scholarly writing sample addressing the following topic: Identify a significant issue confronting educational leaders. Discuss how the issue influences student learning and how your leadership would address this issue. Three letters of recommendation.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Doctor of Education in Educational Leadership program is designed for students who already have a master’s degree and a principal’s license and aspire to become a superintendent or an educational leader in a school district, regional or state organization. The Ed.D. is a cohort-based program with a focus on preparing scholarly practitioners in the field of educational leadership. Graduates of the program are prepared to serve as educational leaders who can apply current research and theory to the solution of problems faced by schools today. The coursework has an emphasis on the superintendency and district-level leadership. The program includes the coursework needed to obtain a Minnesota superintendent license. The program culminates in a scholarly dissertation, or capstone, which is intended to be a culminating experience in the doctoral program where the candidate applies the knowledge and skills they have learned to a meaningful problem of practice.
Accredidation: All programs in the College of Education are accredited by the National Council for Accreditation of Teacher Education (NCATE) and approved by the Minnesota Professional Educator Licensing and Standards Board (PELSB).

ProgramName: Doctorate in Nursing Science, Education, and Practice
Requirements: All DNP applicants must meet the following criteria: Baccalaureate degree in nursing from a program accredited by a national nursing accreditation body (ACEN or CCNE). A master’s degree in nursing is preferred. Minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for undergraduate nursing degree. Current, unencumbered license as a Registered Nurse in Minnesota by the time of first clinical course. Minimum of one year of full-time work experience (or its part-time equivalent) as a registered nurse. Successful completion of an undergraduate or graduate-level statistics course with a grade of C or better is required prior to enrollment. Upon admission, all students will be required to complete a background study. An interview with graduate nursing faculty may be required.
Department: College of Allied Health and Nursing
Concentration: Post-Baccalaureate to DNP, Post-Masters to DNP
Description:
The Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) degree is a practice doctorate that prepares advanced practice nurses to be clinical scholars and leaders. The focus of the DNP is on the translation of research into practice with the goal of improving patient outcomes. The degree may be obtained post-baccalaureate or post-master's. The post-baccalaureate DNP program prepares students for certification in an advanced practice nursing specialty role as a Family Nurse Practitioner (FNP). The Post-Master's DNP program is for certified advanced practice registered nurses (APRNs).

All courses are delivered online with the exception of on campus intensives. Students will also be required to complete practice/clinical hours within their own communities. Students typically attend part-time, taking six credits a semester. Full-time study is also an option.

The School of Nursing is a part of the College of Allied Health and Nursing.
Accredidation: The Doctor of Nursing Practice program at Minnesota State University, Mankato is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).

ProgramName: Doctorate in School Counseling and Guidance Services
EnglishScore: Applicants must meet the university's minimum English proficiency requirement in one of the following ways: TOEFL iBT score of 79 (with minimum subscores of 17 on speaking and 17 on writing) or Paper-based score of 550; IELTS overall score of 6.0 (with no band below 5.5); Duolingo English Test (DET) score of 110; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic score of 53; or Completion of ELS Language Center Level 112.
Requirements:
Complete the Minnesota State Mankato Graduate Studies Application.
Application fee
Two Official Transcripts
Have a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
A master's degree in counseling or a related field from a CACREP accredited program, or its equivalent. A student who graduates from a non-CACREP program will be required to have their curriculum reviewed by a faculty committee to determine any missing coursework. Any missing coursework will be required to be completed post-admission as determined by the faculty committee.
Applicants who have a master's degree in a related field and do not have a license to practice counseling will be required to complete all requirements for licensure as part of their program of study.
Three letters of recommendation from faculty members or other persons who have knowledge of the applicant's academic and professional competence or potential.
Vita or résumé.
A statement of purpose of 500-1000 words describing your professional goals and aspirations relating to your interest in a doctoral degree in counselor education and supervision.
A writing sample from your master's program coursework.
An on-campus interview.
International students have additional admission requirements.
Department: College of Education
Description: The doctoral degree in Counselor Education and Supervision requires 60 semester credits beyond the master’s degree. Students are typically licensed school counselors with at least three years of experience. The degree prepares graduates for careers as counselor educators in university settings, as school counseling program leaders, and as supervisors in school or community agencies. The program is offered via a cohort model and has an approximate three-year completion time.
Accredidation: The School Counseling program at Minnesota State University, Mankato is accredited by the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP).

ProgramName: Doctorate in School Psychology
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting a minimum score from TOEFL (61 iBT or 500 PBT), IELTS (5.5), Duolingo (95), PTE Academic (42), or by completing ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Applicants must have a bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university and a minimum grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Required coursework includes successful completion of at least 18 undergraduate or graduate semester credit hours in psychology, including coursework in statistics, research methodology, child or human development, and abnormal psychology. As part of the online application, you will need to upload a Resume/Vita, a Statement of purpose/autobiographical statement (double spaced, 2-3 pages), and a Writing Sample (a professional paper that demonstrates your academic writing skills). Graduate Record Exam (GRE) General Test scores are not required for admission. Selected applicants will be invited for an on-campus interview.
Department: College of Social and Behavioral Sciences
Description: The Psy.D. in School Psychology program at Minnesota State University, Mankato is designed to produce graduates who are health service psychologists and who function as practitioners within the specialty of school psychology. The program is committed to a practitioner-scholar model of training. The program is designed to provide students with a strong theoretical and practical foundation on which to base their professional work. The program also offers students the opportunity to integrate their knowledge and skills through a sequence of practica and internship experiences. The curriculum includes coursework in psychological foundations, research and evaluation methods, professional school psychology, and intervention strategies. The doctoral program is designed to be a full-time, five-year program. The first four years of the program are spent on campus, and the fifth year is spent in an internship. The program is designed to be sequential and developmental, so students should plan to take courses in the order they are offered. Students are admitted to the program once a year, in the fall semester.
Accredidation: The Doctorate (Psy.D.) in School Psychology program is accredited by the American Psychological Association (APA). The program is also approved by the National Association of School Psychologists (NASP).

ProgramName: Certificate in Applied Health Science
EnglishScore: All applicants, regardless of citizenship, must demonstrate English language proficiency to be considered for admission to a graduate program at Minnesota State University, Mankato. Minimum scores required for admission: TOEFL iBT: 79 (with minimum subscores: writing 20, speaking 20), IELTS: 6.5 (with no sub-score below 6.0), PTE Academic: 58 (with no communication skills sub-score below 53), Duolingo: 110, or successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 112.
Requirements: Baccalaureate degree with a major in health science, community health, school health, nursing, nutrition/dietetics, exercise science, athletic training, or a related field from an accredited institution. GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. To apply to this program, please submit the following: An application for graduate study, Transcripts from all previous institutions, Two letters of recommendation
Department: College of Allied Health and Nursing
Description: The 18-credit Applied Health Science graduate certificate program is designed for students from a variety of backgrounds who want to focus on a particular area of health science. The curriculum includes course offerings from the following programs: athletic training, communication sciences and disorders, community health education, exercise physiology, health care administration, nursing, psychology, recreation, parks and leisure services, social work and sociology. A faculty advisor works with the student to create a personalized plan of study based on the student’s professional and educational goals.

ProgramName: Certificate in Educational Technology
EnglishScore: Students must meet one of the following minimum requirements: TOEFL 79 iBT (with a minimum of 17 on speaking and 17 on writing) or 550 PBT; IELTS 6.5 Overall Band Score (with no band below 6.0); Duolingo 110; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic 58; or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university is required for admission. An official transcript from the institution that awarded your bachelor’s degree. A cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required for admission. One Letter of Recommendation.
Department: College of Education
Description:
The Educational Technology Certificate prepares educators to integrate technology into their teaching. The program aligns with the International Society for Technology in Education (ISTE) standards for educators. Courses address technology integration, instructional design, assistive technology, and trends in the field. Graduates will learn to choose, use, and apply educational technology to promote learning.
After completion of the Educational Technology Certificate, graduates will be able to:
- Select and use a variety of technologies.
- Apply learning theory to instructional design.
- Design inclusive online learning environments.
- Use a variety of assistive technologies.
- Design and deliver professional learning experiences.

ProgramName: Graduate Certificate in Accounting
EnglishScore: International applicants are required to submit scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), PTE Academic, or Duolingo unless they have received a bachelor's degree or higher from a U.S. regionally accredited institution or from a pre-approved country.
Requirements: An earned baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited U.S. institution or a comparable degree from an international institution. A minimum undergraduate grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Prerequisites: Financial Accounting, Managerial Accounting, Intermediate Accounting I & II. Admission is rolling and applicants may begin the program in the fall or spring semester. To apply to this program, you will need to submit: Online application, Application fee, Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions, Official test scores (if applicable). International students have additional admission requirements.
Department: College of Business
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Accounting provides a focused, 12-credit graduate-level curriculum in accounting for individuals who have already earned an undergraduate degree in accounting or an MBA and wish to pursue additional educational opportunities in accounting. The certificate will provide additional accounting knowledge and skills that complement the student’s business experiences and prior education. It will also help students meet the educational requirements for CPA licensure. Students are advised to check with the Board of Accountancy in the state where they intend to seek a license to determine the educational requirements to sit for the CPA exam and for licensure. The certificate is a credential that may be earned on its own or it may be pursued in conjunction with a Minnesota State Mankato MBA degree.
Accredidation: Accredited by AACSB International

ProgramName: Graduate Certificate in Aging Studies
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to take an English proficiency exam. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT 61, TOEFL PBT 500, IELTS 5.5, PTE Academic 47, Duolingo 95, or ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Submit an application to the College of Graduate Studies and Research. Submit official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. Submit two letters of recommendation. Statement of goals for pursuing the certificate. International applicants have additional admission requirements.
Department: College of Allied Health and Nursing
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Aging Studies program is designed to provide students with an interdisciplinary approach to aging and is appropriate for students planning careers working with or for older adults. You'll gain broad-based knowledge of aging, skills and professional competencies in gerontology and be well-prepared for entry-level positions in the aging network. Students currently enrolled in a Minnesota State Mankato graduate program can incorporate the certificate into their curriculum. Professionals already in the field may want to enroll to enhance or update their gerontological knowledge and skills.

ProgramName: Graduate Certificate in Communication and Media
EnglishScore: International applicants must submit one of the following: a TOEFL iBT score of 79 (with minimum subscores of 17 in Speaking and 17 in Writing), an IELTS score of 6.5 (with no subscore below 5.5), a PTE Academic score of 58 (with no subscore below 47), a Duolingo English Test (DET) score of 110, or successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center. Applicants from countries on the English Proficiency Waiver List are exempt.
Requirements: Application requirements are the same as for the M.A. and M.S. degree, however, GRE scores are not required. International students should consult with the Kearney Center for International Student Services to determine is a student visa can be obtained for this certificate program. The M.A. and M.S. application requirements include: A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university, a cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale, a completed online application form, a non-refundable application fee, a statement of purpose (500-750 words), a writing sample, a resume or CV, three letters of recommendation, and official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
Department: College of Humanities & Social Sciences
Description: The certificate is designed for students seeking to update and enhance their strategic communication and media knowledge and skills. It will serve individuals who have already earned an undergraduate degree in communication and media (or related area) and are looking for professional development or a bridge to our master’s programs in communication and media. Students will tailor their elective course work to focus on one of three areas: Communication education, strategic communication, or media studies. The certificate requires 15 credits. Nine of the 15 credits may be applied to a Master of Science or Master of Fine Arts degree in Communication and Media at Minnesota State University, Mankato.

ProgramName: Graduate Certificate in Computer Science and Information Technology
EnglishScore: International applicants must submit an official score from one of the following: TOEFL iBT (minimum total score of 79 with a minimum score of 17 on each of the speaking and writing sections), IELTS Academic (minimum overall score of 6.0 with a minimum score of 5.5 on each of the four bands), PTE Academic (minimum score of 53), Duolingo English Test (minimum score of 110), or ELS Language Centers (completion of Level 112). Applicants from countries where English is the sole official language are exempt.
Requirements:
To be admitted to the graduate certificate program in computer science, applicants must meet one of the following requirements:

1. Hold an MS degree in computer science or a closely related field.
2. Be a currently enrolled MSCS student in good standing at Minnesota State University, Mankato.
3. Hold an undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Computer Information Technology and a GPA of 3.0 or higher.

Students who do not meet these requirements may be provisionally admitted to the program. Please contact the department for more information.
Department: College of Science, Engineering and Technology
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Computer Science and Information Technology will provide students with the most current and relevant skills and knowledge necessary for professionals working with information systems in organizations. The goal of the graduate certificate is to prepare information technology professionals with a bachelor's degree for graduate studies in computer science and information technology and to provide an opportunity for professionals to acquire and update their knowledge and skills in specific areas in computer science and information technology. The graduate certificate is composed of 12 graduate credits (four 3-credit courses). An individual can pursue the certificate while working full time. All courses for the certificate can be completed in two to three semesters. Courses in the graduate certificate may be transferred to the Master of Science in Information Technology (MSIT) or the Master of Science in Computer Science (MSCS) degrees after formal admission to the MSIT or MSCS program (subject to the graduate transfer policies).

ProgramName: Graduate Certificate in Counseling and Student Personnel
EnglishScore: All applicants, regardless of citizenship, must demonstrate English proficiency. One of the following test scores will be accepted to meet the requirement: TOEFL iBT: 61 (or 500 on the paper-based test), IELTS: 5.5, Duolingo English Test (DET): 95, PTE Academic: 42, ELS Language Center: Level 112.
Requirements:
Admission to the College Student Affairs graduate certificate program is on-going and is offered both on-campus and online.

Application Requirements
1. Complete the online application for admission.
2. Submit official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
3. Pay the application fee.
4. Submit a Personal Statement. In this statement, you should address:
    a. Your professional aspirations and how the College Student Affairs certificate program will help you meet those aspirations
    b. What experiences you have had with people who are different from you (e.g., culturally, racially, ethnically, socioeconomically, etc.).
    c. Any additional information you feel would be helpful to the selection committee in reviewing your application (e.g., unique experiences, abilities, etc.).
5. Resume/Curriculum Vitae.
6. Three letters of reference.
7. A cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the bachelor's degree is required for admission.
Department: College of Allied Health and Nursing
Concentration: College Student Affairs
Description: The College Student Affairs (CSA) graduate certificate is a 12-credit certificate program designed to provide students with the foundational knowledge and skills in college student affairs work. This certificate is intended for graduate students in other programs or working professionals interested in learning more about the college student affairs field or looking for a 'stackable' credential in the field. This certificate is not a professional counseling licensure program. Credits earned can be applied towards the College Student Affairs Master's of Science (MS) program.

ProgramName: Graduate Certificate in Criminal Justice
EnglishScore: Evidence of English language proficiency is required of all applicants whose first language is not English, regardless of U.S. citizenship status. The following are the minimum scores required for admission: A minimum score of 79 on the iBT (with a minimum of 17 on speaking and writing sections); A minimum score of 550 on the paper-based test; A minimum score of 6.5 on the IELTS exam; A minimum score of 53 on the Pearson's Test of English (PTE); A minimum score of 110 on the Duolingo English Test; Completion of level 112 at an ELS language center.
Requirements: An undergraduate degree from a regionally accredited university. A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. A one-page statement of purpose explaining the student's background and interest in the program. Two letters of recommendation. A resume or curriculum vitae. The Government Department does not require GRE scores for admission.
Department: College of Social and Behavioral Sciences
Description: The online Criminal Justice Graduate Certificate is designed to provide students with a broader understanding of law enforcement, corrections and the court system. This certificate is a pathway for students to continue on to the Criminal Justice Master of Science program. This certificate program does not accept PSEO or undergraduate students. The program is offered fully online.

ProgramName: Graduate Certificate in Educational Leadership
EnglishScore: All applicants, regardless of citizenship, must demonstrate English language proficiency. This can be met by submitting official test scores from tests such as TOEFL iBT (minimum 61), IELTS (minimum 5.5), PTE (minimum 47), or Duolingo (minimum 95). Applicants may also meet the requirement through completion of secondary or post-secondary education in certain English-speaking countries.
Requirements:
Admission to the certificate program is competitive and requires the following:

An earned Bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution.
A cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the Bachelor's degree.
At least 3 years of P-12 teaching, educational leadership, or comparable experience (e.g., student support personnel, district office support staff, etc.)
Two references from individuals who can speak to the applicant's leadership potential.
Submission of a written essay that responds to the prompt: What is the purpose of P-12 education, and what are the primary barriers to achieving that purpose? (The essay will be evaluated on the following criteria: clarity of thought, depth of insight into the topic, quality of the writing, organization, focus, voice, and conventions).
Submission of the online application and fees to the College of Graduate Studies and Research.
Department: College of Education
Concentration: Racially Conscious School and Systems Leadership
Description: The 12-credit, fully online Racially Conscious School and Systems Leadership graduate certificate program is designed for current and aspiring school and systems leaders who are invested in leading for racial equity. Through coursework and a culminating project, students will demonstrate mastery of the following competency areas: Leadership for Racial Equity, Racially Conscious Instructional Leadership, Racially Conscious Relational Leadership, and Racially Conscious Systems Leadership.

ProgramName: Graduate Certificate in English
Requirements:
Completed application for graduate study.
Official transcripts of all undergraduate and graduate coursework.
A three- to five-page statement of purpose that explains the applicant’s interest in the particular certificate and how certificate coursework will benefit the applicant’s professional and/or personal goals.
A writing sample that demonstrates the applicant’s skills in critical analysis and argumentation (10-15 pages for certificates in Literature and in Rhetoric & Composition; 20-25 pages of creative prose or 10-15 pages of poetry for the certificate in Creative Writing).
Three letters of recommendation.
A curriculum vitae or resume.
GRE scores are not required.

ProgramName: Graduate Certificate in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages
EnglishScore: A minimum score of 79 on the Internet-based TOEFL, or a 6.5 on the IELTS.
Requirements: Completed application for graduate study. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended. A GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required for admission.
